characters: THE SOUND OF A WINTER WIND
IN THE HALL TO THE BATHROOMS
TO REVEAL THE MAIN SECURITY AREA
AROUND THE SIDE OF THE HOTEL
TO FIND GABRIEL, MERLIN, JUMPY AND PUG
HE GIVES IT A SOLEMN STARE
GABRIEL RAISES A DART TO THROW
FIGURE IN A SANTA CLAUS SUIT

dialogues.speaker: FIGURE IN A SANTA CLAUS SUIT
dialogues.text: lies face-down in a nighttime expanse of snow. One of the body's red-sleeved arms is twisted at a sickening angle. white snow beneath the figure is spreading with red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure in the suit lies motionless. Snowflakes drift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark, rustic wood, an office with broken windows and whis winter beyond. A second BODY in a Santa Claus suit lies d in the doorway. It's a man with a large build. The suit is riddled with h His face is missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More snow falling. A handful of cars in the lot. A third  BODY in the same red-and-white outfit lies atop the hood an old Pontiac. His head is not visible, having smashed  through the windshield. His suit is charred and blackened A halo of broken glass outlines him. His black boots hang off the front bumper. The parking lot is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A floor scattered with shiny silver quarters. Reflections neon. There's a fourth SANTA here, face-down in a red poo The suit is far too big for him. Not that it matters now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where the fifth and final Santa lies at the edge of a rav which plummets a hundred feet down. The man rests precari atop the slope, upside-down, eyes closed. His burned suit is smoldering. He has a sly but tired fac late-20's, sandy hair, cold and scarred. This is RUDY DUN He opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never was much for the holidays.

dialogues.speaker: THE SOUND OF A WINTER WIND
dialogues.text: rises, as a TITLE appears: "SEVEN DAYS BEFORE..." And then, to complete the sentence: "...XMAS."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow drifts down onto the stone walls and wire fences of Iron Mountain, Michigan S.I.C. Winter's been here awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy Duncan lies in his top bunk, staring at his ceiling where a handful of paper-cut snowflakes have been pasted. The sounds of YELLING INMATES and GATES slamming shut ech through the fortress. Rudy watches a spider scurry across the paper snow. It's his excitement for the day. He turns to the wall, where there's a photo of his teenag self with some co-workers at an auto body shop. And a fam photo, cheery Midwesterners, with Rudy a scowling Artful  Dodger.

dialogues.speaker: A WALL CALENDAR
dialogues.text: Shows the dates have been crossed off up to December 18th December 22nd is circled again and again. Rudy muses at the calendar, then hops out of his bunk. Dr to the floor, crosses to a desk, finds a chewed-on pen.  Turning back to the beds we reveal --

dialogues.speaker: THE LOWER BUNK
dialogues.text: where Rudy's cellmate, NICK MASON (32), rugged, mustached and well-built, sleeps soundly. In contrast, his bed-wall a COLLAGE OF PHOTOGRAPHS, twenty, maybe thirty of them. A a mural. All of them photos of A BEAUTIFUL YOUNG GIRL, mid-twentie smiling out from beaches, parties and snowy scenes. Gorge brown hair, heartbreaking smile. Effortlessly sexy.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: stares at the pictures for a moment, wistful. Nick snores turns over. Rudy climbs atop his bunk again, with the pen this time. And crosses December 18th off the calendar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two of them, Nick and Rudy, shivering by the fence. N absently whistles some "Silver Bells," then digs for a sm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the first thing, man? What's  the first thing you're gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't thought about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell you haven't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get to thinking about it, it won't  happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We walk outta here, we hit that road,  what's the first thing you're gonna  do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't there yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three days, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' Christmas, man. Fuckin,  Christmas on the outs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dozens of uniformed INMATES wander the yard, stamping fee hands tucked away, breath frosting. Nick tries to light h cig, but the wind plays havoc. Nick curses, tosses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot chocolate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a hot mug of chocolate. (nods) First thing I'm gonna do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) And a slice of pecan pie, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And some pecan pie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick laughs, stares through the fence at the gates of the prison's entrance road. Longingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gonna be out there, man. Right  there. Right there waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna walk out of this shitstorm and  right into her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got us a motel out Highway 5, bringing  her own damn sheets, you read that  part? Silk damn sheets. Lock ourselves  in the whole week, drinking wine,  taking baths, man, see if they got  those room service steaks... anything  I want to do. Remember when she wrote  that? Anything I want...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Fuckin' Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick grins. They stand there, shivering. It's freezing, b the time they get outside is too precious to give up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All those pictures she's sent...  y'know... you sure they're all of  her, Nick? You hear sometimes they  don't send their real pictures. Could  be her cousin or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick studies him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you gotta say a thing like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you gotta. We were gonna give  you a ride someplace, man. Now I  just don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck your hot chocolate, Rudy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They trail off in silence. Nick looks out at the prison r again. A snowy wasteland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna marry this girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy lies in his bunk, staring at the same paper snowflak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, listen here. "I've made my  list and I've checked it twice, and  as long as you're naughty, it's gonna  be nice. These cold winter weeks  have been killing me, Nick, as I lie  here alone. It's not enough to have  your warmth in my heart anymore; I  need your warmth next to me. Work at  Penney's has been busy because it's  Christmas and that's when we do almost  half of our business for the whole  year -- ", okay, whatever, whatever -- (skipping on) " -- my manager's still mad at me  for asking for the whole week off,"  whatever, whatever -- (smiles) Here we go. "And all that gets me  through the day is to close my eyes  and imagine holding you, and kissing  you, and touching you, and tasting  you everywhere because I know at  that moment, I'll feel I've found  the reason for my whole entire life."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy still stares at the stone ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For twenty-five, she sounds pretty  mature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You grow up in Detroit, you  get matured real quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's doing pushups on the floor below, smoking a cig,  reading sheets of pink stationery. With a new photo: of t same GIRL, in a bikini by a lake. Vamping a childish pose

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure as hell don't make me miss Millie  Bobek. Guess I owe Millie, though.  If I hadn't been rollin, her, I woulda  never ended up here. And I woulda  never met Ashley. (studies photo) That's the world for ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick climbs off the floor, paces back to the bunks, marve at the latest letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if she sees you, man, sees what  you look like... and it's not there.   You just don't do it for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and her got a connection. (hands page to him) Read this part. Read the part about  stuffing her stocking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick drops the page on his stomach. Rudy sighs, picks it brings it to his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's using a new perfume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I think that's just oranges. She  writes here she's eating oranges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoulda written to that magazine,  Rudy. I'm gonna walk outta here,  walk right into a relationship. Not  some one-nighter, man... a  relationship. You? You're gonna walk  outta here with bus fare. Searching  for the drunkest skirt in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mornin', gorgeous. More egg nog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoulda written, Rudy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick drops back to his bunk, pasting the new lakeside pho among his collage of pictures. Admiring his pen pal:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoulda got yourself a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above, Rudy peruses the page Nick gave him. Some lipstick marks pressed to the paper. He passes it back, closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I want... is to make it to Sidnaw,  and sit down for Christmas dinner.  Watch some ball with my old man,  sleep in my old bed, and have  leftovers for bout six months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you hated Sidnaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just taste that Christmas turkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you hate your old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five years, Nicky. Five years. (shrugs) I just want to go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's the echo of CRASHING metal gates. Prisoners YELLI Nick smiles, still staring at his girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, man. Me and Ashley. We'll be  thinking about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUARDS monitor PRISONERS as they file out of their cells the afternoon meal. Rudy and Nick are motioned out by a M GUARD, his bitter world etched in his face. They join the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Alamo's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across Broadway, a parallel line is forming. A tall, tatt Native American, THE ALAMO, steps out of his cell. His ha are the size of a man's skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look like he missed the  sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinscher told me Alamo thinks I'm  the one ratted on him beating up  Cree. Since I was there, I saw it,  he thinks I got him sent to solitary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, Rudy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment, Alamo glances over. Finds Rudy's eyes. Ru swiftly looks away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Count me outta mealtime --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slaps Nick an the back, heads back for their cell --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GET BACK IN LINE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not hungry, I'm gonna --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOULDA STAYED IN YOUR HOLE! GET  BACK IN FUCKING LINE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mean guard pulls his blackjack. Another guard's ready behind him. They want Rudy to give them trouble. Rudy stops. Slides back into the line of prisoners. Looks across Broadway. The Alamo's walked on up ahead. Rudy  swallows, heads toward the mess hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GLOOPY SPOON of CHUNKY RED AND GREEN JELLO gets sploosh on Rudy's plate. Same with Nick. It's the cafeteria line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holiday jello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this shit in it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swallow and see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ugly staffer grins from under his plastic hairnet. Ni looks to Rudy, then turns back to the help:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just so you know, this man and I are  outta here in two days. So while  we're inhaling London broil and  lobster bisque, you're gonna still  be standing here smelling up the  mystery creamfuck. (nods) Who's in prison now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ugly staffer curls his lip. Nick smiles. Rudy moves o taking his tray off the rail and turning -- -- right into the chest of The Alamo. He looks up -- into the most scarred and vengeful face a man could ever dread see. The Alamo's a lifer. Many times over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you don't expect it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't me, Alamo --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alamo strides into the cafeteria line. Rudy finally t a breath, as if he's dodged death. Nick's at his shoulder They share a grave and worried look. Trying to help:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy and Nick sit at a cafeteria table. Beside Rudy is a  frail, nervous, fiftyish inmate, ZOOK. Zook sits alone, t to no one, always has the shakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So maybe after our week beneath the  sheets, we'll head down to Motor  City for New Year's. She says her  roommate's skipping town for a few  days, have the place to ourselves.   Remember how her brother's a truck  driver down there? I'm thinking he  might be able to help get me some  work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, working security?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm through with that shit.  Ashley's right. Gotta start doing  something I got a stake in. Get a  business going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I've seen the business  world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hotwiring cars, Rudy, does not qualify  as a small business. Chop shop  consultant; doesn't work on a resume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy shrugs. He checks across the room, on the whereabout of The Alamo. The big Indian has his back turned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley's talking about maybe we can  start something up together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next to Rudy, Zook has stopped eating. He is still as sto staring at his tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatsa matter, Zook?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both watch Zook put down his utensils and reach into his red-and-green jello with his bare hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell you doing, Zookerman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloppy gelatin drips from his hand, as the frail man lift large black cockroach out. Zook's shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a roach, Zook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you. Protein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monsters in the gelatin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a roach, guy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are monsters... (voice rising) ...in the gelatin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zook stands up, holding jello aloft:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THERE ARE MONSTERS IN THE GELATIN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Fuckin, Zookerman --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THERE ARE MONSTERS! IN THE GELATIN!   THERE ARE MONSTERS! IN THE GELATIN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GRUMBLING MURMUR sweeps through the cafeteria as inmate sift through their jello, searching for --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonofabitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls something bug-like out of his dessert, holds it  aloft, and then HURLS it at the cafeteria line. A STAFFER ducks away. The inmates LAUGH and suddenly they're all on their feet --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THERE ARE MONSTERS! IN THE GELATIN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- grabbing handfuls of jello and throwing it at the cafe line. Inmates get errantly SPLASHED, and respond by wheel on their fellow inmates -- red and green globs flying to fro!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIT DOWN! SIT THE FUCK BACK DOWN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As GUARDS immediately rush in to restore order --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy, don't move --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two days, we got two days! Don't do  nothing. Don't touch nothing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An INMATE at the end of their table picks up their table overturns it, sending food flying. Rudy and Nick stand ba hands raised in surrender. Jello HITS Rudy in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move, Rudy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing right here, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zook is still SHOUTING until a GUARD clubs him senseless  with a blackjack. WHISTLES are blowing. Guards SCREAM for order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as a GUARD eyes them) Ate the jello, jello was fine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard leaves them alone, runs on. The melee's still o of control. As Rudy turns -- -- and suddenly sees The Alamo charging across the room,  with murderous eyes, a metal shank in his hand! Five feet away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUDY, LOOK OUT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick grabs him, trying to push him out of the way -- -- and The Alamo's shank plunges deep into Nick's stomach burying between his ribs. Blood splashes. Nick slumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alamo pulls the blade out with a ferocious YELL, push Nick to the floor and spins on Rudy! Rudy blocks with a c stumbling back, cartwheeling over a table as The Alamo ro over him for the kill -- -- and two GUARDS tackle the big Indian out of nowhere!  Knocking the knife away, hammering him with blackjacks. I takes another three guards to keep The Alamo down. Rudy scrambles across the floor. Nick's on his back, bloo pumping freely from his gut --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUARD! GUARD!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in shock) Alamo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUARD!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's helping, the guards nearby all subduing The Alam Nick grabs Rudy's shirt, gasping to speak --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Rudy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it, man! You're all right!   Hold it in! GUARD!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck, Rudy... oh Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUARD!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash... Ashley...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, man! No, no, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (choking) Tell her... I'll be there ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're GONNA be there! We're getting  outta here! TAKE IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Ashley... I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU TELL HER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...be with her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood spills out Nick's mouth. His eyes go vacant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...for Christmas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Rudy's suddenly hauled backwards. A trio of GUARDS  descend, grabbing Nick's body as his life fades away. Dra his figure out of the melee. WHISTLES are blowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GET HIM OUT OF HERE! LOCK DOWN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy struggles, enraged, and gets blackjacked across the  skull for his trouble. He hits the jello-covered floor. And the world goes dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darkness and shadows. Rudy sits in a corner, holding his  head. The cell block silent for the first time. Bootsteps from down the row. A SHADOW falls across Rudy's somber figure. It's the Mean Guard. He stares at Rudy wit distinct pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man had two days...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. Least he won't be coming back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard grins a gold tooth. Rudy looks at him -- -- and then springs to his feet, charges the room, grabbi through the bars. The guard takes a calm step back. Keeps the cruel smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need company tonight, Rudy...  you just give a holler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puckers a kiss and walks on. Starts whistling "Are You Lonesome Tonight?" Several shadowed VOICES request that h shut the fuck up. The bootsteps and melody drift down the row.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: turns back, starts toward his bunk. And stops. His eyes o Nick's empty bed. And the wall behind.

dialogues.speaker: THE PICTURES OF ASHLEY
dialogues.text: Smiling, laughing, playing kissy-face. Hearts drawn on th photos. All colors of stationery taped to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: takes a seat on Nick's bed. There's a shoebox at the foot it. Rudy opens it. It's filled with Ashley's letters. He trails a finger along them, must be over a hundred pag He selects the one nearest the front. Surveys it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy, man, here we go, here, what  she wrote here: "The car's waiting.  The motel's waiting. And I'm waiting.   I've waited for so long. I'm burning  for you, Nick. My whole body. My  whole heart. I'm burning for you..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy turns to the wall. To the lakeside picture of Ashley swimsuit siren. Rudy stares sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was burning for you too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And puts the letter away.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY'S CALENDAR
dialogues.text: As his hand slashes through December 21st. Prison's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow swirls. Near blizzard conditions. A heavy steel door BANGS open, held by an EXIT GUARD. And FIFTEEN CONVICTS,  make that EX-CONVICTS, trudge onto a fenced drive, covere in snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your world and welcome to it,  dumbfucks! Don't be a stranger now!  We'll keep the lights on for ya!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy stumbles out with the group, shivering in a Goodwill hand-me-down coat. Thin canvas, wouldn't keep him warm in summer. Secondhand shoes. No possessions. He clutches his sides with his hands, hunched over. All  fifteen huddle and herd toward the gate at the end of the fenceway.

dialogues.speaker: BEYOND THE GATE
dialogues.text: There are a dozen FRIENDS and RELATIVES waiting. A few ME several WOMEN, a couple KIDS. Bundled in winter coats, ha and hoods. A prison shuttle bus is parked behind them. The released cons reach the gate, where a GATE GUARD unlo the fence to the outside world. Fifteen men are free. The ex-cons and relatives scan each other's faces. Wives  rush over to embrace their men. Pals nod to ex-cons and t slaps on backs. Reunion time. The snow batters them, wind whipping. Rudy keeps his head down, leaning forward, keeps walking. Toward the bus. But can't help himself -- he glances up --

dialogues.speaker: TO SEE A YOUNG WOMAN
dialogues.text: bundled in a silver ski jacket, pink wool hat with a poof on top, scarf and mittens. Scanning the released prisoner

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: drops his head, looks away. Climbs onto the shuttle bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy shakes his arms, basking in the vehicle's warmth. Ta a seat at the back. A couple other lone ex-cons climb abo Then the cons with relatives start to pile in. Rudy's window is steamed against the cold. He stares into his lap, then reaches for his coat pocket. Takes out the  picture of Ashley, in her bikini by the lake. Stares at i He rubs his window with his sleeve. Outside, the woman in the silver coat turns this way and  that, troubled. She's watching the other ex-cons climbing onto the bus with their loved ones. The woman looks back to the prison. The guard closing the gate. The steel door has been shut. No one else is coming Rudy watches her sadly. Aboard the bus, the seats fill up. Ex-cons are feeling up their wives, kids are climbing on their absent daddies,  buddies are jawing loudly 'bout how the neighborhood's  changed. The woman outside is now alone. Silver coat, pink poofbal Rudy looks at the bikini picture again. Then at the shivering bundle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it, Rudy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus ENGINE starts up. In the seat beside Rudy, an EX- makes out with his WIFE while his bratty KID punches his  leg. Out the window, the young woman is scanning the bus windo Then the prison again. She turns in a worried circle. Rud looks swiftly away. Closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus door closes. It REVS and starts forward. Rudy sig with relief. The photo of Ashley falls to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young woman watches the bus pull away, down the snowy road. But it doesn't get fifty feet before it suddenly st The door opens. And Rudy steps out. The bus REVS up again and GROANS OFF into the winter. The young woman pushes her poofball hat out of her eyes. get a look at her face for the first time. Skin pale, lip turning blue, but it's the girl from the pictures. It's  Ashley. She watches Rudy's figure trudge back toward her. Snow  obscuring him until he's right in front of her. Both of t shivering. Both of them standing there. And finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Ashley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley nods. And Rudy sadly smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy and Ashley sit at a coffee shop booth. Coats still o Big rigs bluster by on the highway outside. Two untouched cups of coffee sit before them. She's watching him in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like your coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley says nothing. Rudy looks at his own:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This -- this is just something they  gave me at the door. Wasn't snowing  when we signed up, y'know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley looks at it, like she's just realizing it's there. She lifts the cup, takes a sip. Puts it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy nods. Silence again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta be ten degrees out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Radio said negative five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative five?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think it's negative five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Radio said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind chill. That's probably what  they meant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley nods. Rudy bites his lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was scared. Scared you were gonna  take one look at me and change your  mind. Scared I was walking into  heartache. All those words... you  put a picture in your mind of where  they come from and when you see where  maybe it's not the same as your  picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He trails off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured you walked outta there and  saw me and walked right the other  way --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saw my outfit or something, my coat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, hey, I like your coat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saw me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley, no. That was me, that's what  I was scared of. I mean, be serious...   I ain't exactly looking like Mr.   Universe here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy goes silent. Whoa. Ashley considers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you wrote you had a mustache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can get another one going. Y'know,  hey, whatever you want me to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no. Be like you want to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another awkward pause. Rudy picks up a milk dispenser bes the coffee, puts it to his lips. It gives him a wide whit mustache. He stares straight-faced. Ashley gives a bashful smile, covers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do that again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley smiles again, blushing now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more. Smile. One more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying not to) No, c'mon --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been dreaming about that smile,  Ashley Mercer. For a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare across the table, drifting into one another's  eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're better than the picture in my  mind, Nick... (softly) You're real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, another truck rumbles by, whipping up snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Rudy and Ashley SLAM inside, kissing passionately, li intertwined, pawing at each other's coats. Rudy kicks the door closed. Mouths devouring, hands lost in snowy hair. They collide with a side table, knocking over a lamp, tum onto the lumpy bed. Rudy tears at her silver coat and swe and turtleneck and capilene and whatever else's she got o as Ashley's lips explore his neck and body. Writhing and  wrestling and rolling off the bed. Bang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy and Ashley fuck like lovers in R-rated movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bed sheets lie tangled on the floor. Rudy and Ashley  rest naked amidst them. Her pretty young head on his ches all their inhibitions gone. Rudy strokes her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me something. This the first  time you've ever done this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to hell, Nick Mason, what's that  supposed to mean --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not that, no... (laughs, kisses her) I mean this, the whole thing. Start  writing to a guy, guy in the bricks.  Get a boyfriend like this. Tell me  the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. You're not the first guy I  wrote to. But you're the only one I  kept writing to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Me too. (considers) Why? I mean I know why for me, why I  paid for the ad. But you... why start  writing to some guy -- some con --  you don't even know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley studies his face, smiles in reflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, Nick. Remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the guys I've ever been with...  they never want to know me. Who I am  on the inside. They just want to qet  inside. When they do, they think  that means they know who I am. That  I trust them. That they know me.  That there's nothing left to learn. (beat) A guy like you, Nick -- six months  before you can even touch my face. I  figure a guy in that kind of bind,  he's gonna hafta work to get to know  me some other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had some bad relationships, didn't  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad. Just regular. (smiles) You wrote me wonderful things, Nick.   Personal things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to him, kisses his chest --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, wasn't all me, y'know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it was all you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy I was in with... he helped  sometimes... some of the romantic  stuff, actually... you'd like him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking about the heart, Nick.  I'm not talking about the words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know, some of the heart mighta  been his too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he shoulda signed his name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns over playfully, eases herself back atop him. Re to make up for lost time. With a kiss:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he'd be here right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley runs through an Xmas-decorated megamall, dragging  Rudy behind her. Both of them laughing, as she hauls him  over to some cookie bakery company:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Provisions! We are not leaving that  motel room again till after New  Year's: we need ten days worth of  provisions! (to cookie matron) What's good?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my, we've got a special on our  chocolate crunchie elves, they're  shaped like little helpers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIS MAN... has not had a cookie in  two goddamn years! Get him two of  everything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley, Jesus --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't survive on our bodies alone,  Nick. (to cookie matron) Hurry up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash... didn't you write me that you  don't eat chocolate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well you wrote me you were six- foot-four, baby. (teasing smile) So don't talk to me about little  white lies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teddy bears with nightcaps, green bows, red ribbons. Ashl tearing through men's clothing racks, all love and confid Rudy's got a bunch of purchase bags weighing him down:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need a COAT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash, you've gotten me enough --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No boyfriend of mine is going to  walk around in negative-five degree  wind chill without a goddamn good- looking coat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls out a hellacious black leather fringe number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, c'mon, all this stuff... I  haven't gotten you anything --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got out, Nick. You're here.   You're my Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts the jacket against his chest, smiling. Rudy sigh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's two hundred dollars, Ash --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She whips a Penney's card from her purse, grins wickedly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forget where I work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Beauty and fragrances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty percent off, motherfucker. Ho  ho ho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs off with the jacket. Rudy turns to a dressing mi left to stare at his reflection. An ex-con in rags, with half-dozen holiday shopping bags. To himself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just for the holidays, Nick. Then  we'll tell her. We'll let her...  have her holidays...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy nods till he convinces himself. Can't help but smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puzzles, Barbies and dinosaurs. KIDS scurrying, PARENTS  chasing. Rudy and Ashley with a scared TEEN CLERK:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't find... what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toys for adults. Where are your toys  for adults?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toys for... adults?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon. How old are you, sixteen?  C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sell children's toys --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slams money down) I got fifty dollars to spend in your  store, Jesus of Nazareth. Can you  help me or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clerk glances around, then, low:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slinky's in aisle five, Twister's in  aisle one, Moon Mud's in aisle four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: CONVEYOR
dialogues.text: As bottles of wine, vodka and rum, cartons of egg nog and orange juice, and countless prepackaged sandwiches come  scrolling past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I was thinking, after  our holiday hideaway? Instead of  going back to Detroit, maybe we could  go gambling. Y'know? Drive up to  that Indian place you worked at.  Wouldn't that be fun? I haven't gone  gambling in forever!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light snow falls. Rudy, in his new black fringe eyesore, Ashley carry grocery bags across the icy asphalt:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know about that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blackjack, Nick, blackjack I am good  at. I mean, they'd give us some free  games or something, wouldn't they?  Since you worked there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security, Ash, I just worked security.   They wouldn't be rolling out the red  carpet --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the slots, slots I'm good at  too. Wouldn't that be fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have more fun in Detroit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could live it up and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley. We're not going anywhere I  used to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It comes out too harsh. Ashley stops, a little hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just... I thought you'd have friends  there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy softens, touches her arms:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I been in prison for two years,  Ash. Believe me. Those guys wouldn't  want to see me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her. She nods, dismisses it, kisses back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, they don't know what the hell  they're missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley's Chevy Nova pulls back into the lot of the roadsi joint. There's an artificial (silver) Christmas tree tied the roof. She and Rudy climb out; she heads for the office:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, I'm gonna go tell 'em not to  disturb us for the rest of the year.  I get back in that room, you better  be wearing nothing but a candy cane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see what I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, lover. I'll see what you can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles, sashays sexily away. Rudy watches her go, adm his good fortune. Then pops the trunk, collects some of t shopping score. Gifts and goodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sings, sotto) I have no gifts to bring, parum-pum- pum-pum. No treasures for the king,  pa-rum-pum-pum-pum...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loaded down, he struggles to the motel room, balances bag on his knee, gets the key in the door, and heads inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pitch dark. Rudy fumbles his way in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but I got a girl to be with, rum- pum-pum-pum...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy drops the shopping bags, whirls around, as a stocky  black shadow, MERLIN, all 280 pounds of him, KICKS the do shut --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and SWINGS a baseball bat toward Rudy's chest. Rudy ge an arm down to deflect the blow, but it still stings like mother. Rudy HOWLS. Merlin comes at him again -- -- and this time Rudy slips by. Merlin's bat SHATTERS a  dresser. Rudy grabs him by the neck, kicks out his knees and wrest him to the ground. Grabs the bat -- -- and gets DECKED from behind by another shadow, PUG, a  little white guy with a snarl. They go CRASHING onto the  bed, grappling for leverage, and then to the floor -- -- where Rudy grabs a champagne bottle from the groceries and BASHES it backwards, shattering it over Pug's head! Pug lets go, as Rudy scrambles up, and Merlin's got him a in a bear hug. Rudy's struggling, whirling with him, cras into one wall, then another, YELLING for help --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEYYY!!! IN HERE!!! HEYYY!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- until he hears the PUMP-LOAD SNAP of a shotgun. Rudy stops still. A lamp clicks on. Standing in silhouette, a figure in a leather duster hold sawed-off on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another lamp comes on. Rudy, still in Merlin's choke-hold gets a look at the gunman, GABRIEL. Weathered face, strin hair, early 30's. Handsome in a scuzzy way. He's seen a l of road. Rudy stares, totally thrown. Pug, the little guy, bad tee bad hair, bad skin, gets up spitting blood and champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I owe ya a drink, ya fuck --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and slugs Rudy in the gut. Merlin yanks him back up.  Merlin's a black widebody, wears a goatee and brass knuck Behind Merlin stands a fourth intruder, a stone-faced Ind in a Grateful Dead longsleeve. JUMPY. Guarding the door. Gabriel's studying Rudy, up and down. Nods. Merlin relaxe his choke-hold so Rudy can breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... you don't know me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I know you, Nick. I know you  real well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you can't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the room's door gets kicked open --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out, baby! I'm bringing in the  fucking tree!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and the silver fake evergreen fills the doorway, getting  forced through with Ashley's grunts and groans --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASHLEY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin traps his jaw shut. The tree comes squeezing throu followed by Ashley, face in branches --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, we got the best one  in the store... I don't know why  people want their houses smelling  like the stupid woods...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's GRABBED from behind by Jumpy. Ashley screams, but h slams her against the wall. The tree hits the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy fights to help her, but Merlin's got him. Pug locks  Ashley's arms. She fights, muffled cries, but Jumpy and P have her held firmly. Her face to the wall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the silver tree) Hope her taste in men's better than  her taste in Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley's turned to face him. Her eyes widen. Gabriel nods

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, sis. Happy holidays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy's jaw drops. He looks to Ashley. Then to Gabriel. Ashley YELLS, enraged, kicking and clawing. Jumpy slams h back against the wall for her trouble --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jumpy, don't hurt her, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel steps to Rudy. Studies him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. This is the guy you been waiting  for. Man of your dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unimpressed) Must have a way with stationery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel, what are you doing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel raises the sawed-off to Rudy's chest. Rudy flinch but Merlin's got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GABRIEL!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel fixes her with a stare. She shuts up. To Rudy:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better be here to be good to  her, loverboy. 'Cause she's been  good to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel, let him go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read a lot about you, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read you're a man of some knowledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man of some travels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GABRIEL, I LOVE HIM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy's trying to speak, voice CHOKED. Gabriel nods to Mer who again eases his hold. Rudy coughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm... not... Nick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel frowns. Rudy turns to Ashley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not him. I... (then to Gabriel) You want something from Nick, you  got the wrong guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurt) Nick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel looks from her to him, then lowers his sawed-off, and SWINGS it into Rudy's stomach. Rudy buckles. Panicked

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got the wrong guy! She thinks  I'm Nick, I'm not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Merlin) Put him in the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in the joint with him! I knew  about him and her, okay!? I took his  place!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You what...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got out, Nick didn't! I pretended  I was him! I knew about her letters!   Jesus Christ, whatever you want from  him -- I'm not Nick! (to Ashley) I -- I just wanted to be --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glance of regret amidst his desperation. Ashley stares  back, confused, searching his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not Nick Mason...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shared his cell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you were saying you were...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you could get with my sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you could get down her chimney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you think telling me that's gonna  help your cause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel RATCHETS him across the chin with the gun butt. R hits the floor. Gabriel spins on Ashley, enraged:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this him!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaches for Rudy) Don't hurt him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this the fucker you been writing  all year!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaches for Rudy) Please, Gabriel, don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel puts the gun to Rudy's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IS THIS NICK MASON!!??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YES!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel doesn't shoot. Studies Rudy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he's gonna have to learn to  give you some respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel KICKS Rudy in the jaw. Ashley screams. Gabriel mo to his boys: Jumpy and Pug drag her outside. Gabriel KICK Rudy again. Rudy lies there and takes it. Merlin lights a cig, examines Rudy and Ashley's grocery b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. They got a shitload of cookies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout the tree? You want the  tree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin nods, tucks the bags under his arms, leaves the ro Gabriel drops beside Rudy, with a sick smile:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've read your letters, motherfucker.   Don't play no reindeer games with  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we SWOOP DOWN onto a four-lane stretch of winter highw arcing into the blackness. CLOSING ON an 18-wheel tractor trailer, RUMBLING onward,  emblazoned with "Great Lakes Trucking." There's an airbru painting on the door to the cab, of a skeleton looking th a flaming radial tire, and the legend "Motor City Monster

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel at the wheel, Merlin smoking, Jumpy eating cookie A TRUCK passes; Gabriel waves. A moment later, the CB  crackles:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there, Monster! What're you  hauling this far north?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, Bugeye. How you doin'? Ain't  hauling, man, I'm up for the holidays.  Gonna have myself a holiday... for a  goddamn change...

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: eyes closed, dried blood, head rocking side to side. He  winces, waking, with the headache to end all headaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh, Nick, shh. They won't hurt you  now. You're okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her hand strokes his face. Rudy's eyes struggle open.

dialogues.speaker: ON FULL SCENE
dialogues.text: They're in the back of the truck. There's some packing ma rope, two tall storage lockers, and Ashley's Chevy Nova. Rudy's head is in her lap. He struggles to sit up, finds wrists tied with cord. He looks at Ashley, follows her ga In a corner, Pug sits guard in a beanbag chair. He's dipp chewing tobacco, reading Road & Track, headphones on. Rudy a bored glance, then back to his magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't let 'em, Nick. They won't  hurt you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley nods. Rudy looks around, remembering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the truck driver...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not a bad person, Nick... he's  not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the corner, Pug spits some chaw. Ashley wheels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not gonna hurt him anymore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pug doesn't even look up. Still stroking Rudy's face:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since Janey moved in... Gabriel...  he's come over more and more. To the  apartment. Janey's the divorced one,  'member, with the tit job --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He read the letters, Nick. Some day  I wasn't there. He went through my  room. He found your letters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going ON!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck shakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows you worked in that casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy stares at her. She's scared

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, no --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sold him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When'd you decide to do it, Ash?   After which of his letters, huh?   The fortieth? The fiftieth? The  first?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, what are you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches out for him; Rudy scrambles to his knees, tum against the opposite wall of the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'M NOT NICK! (raging) You thought you'd fuck him over?!   Well he's fucked you! I've never  worked at some casino! I can't help  you! Because he's not me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, I love you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESUS CHRIST!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your mouth, man. It's Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'M NOT NICK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley runs at him, wraps her arms around him tightly. He tries to fight her off. She won't let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the hell off of me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hard whisper) Nick, it won't work. It won't work!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy stops fighting. She has a terrified look in her eye. Checks to Pug: he's watching them now, chewing slower. As turns them away from the little guy's view

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not hearing me here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother's killed people, I know  he has. Truckers. If you talk him  into thinking you're not you, you'll  only get yourself dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't "find" Nick's letters, did  he.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, please, it's me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told him about Nick's letters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Nick, no --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy stares at her coldly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know, in a way, I'm glad it's me.  'Cause you woulda broken his heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley stares, panicked. Pug's still watching them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your pen palls dead, lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you say that, if you keep saying  that, they will kill you. If they  think you're not you, they will kill  you. Don't you see? I know what you're  doing, but it won't work!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick died for me....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't let him hurt you! He just  wants what you know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ruefully) ...maybe I die for Nick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell him what you know, Nick!  That's all they want! And we'll get  out of this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy gives her a stone cold stare. Ashley crumbles, touch his face, shaking her head, tears. Devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He found them... I swear, Nick... (helpless) ...he found them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck shudders through downshifts, to a groaning stop Ashley embraces Rudy fiercely, holding on for the last. The trailer gate RATTLES open into the truck's roof. Ashley shuts her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rig all alone at a snowy rest area. Gabriel, Merlin a Jumpy climb inside as silhouette sentries. Gabriel survey then lifts a piece of paper:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "My sweet, sexy Ashy-lashy, I have  been dreaming of you constantly, and  knowing you are out there makes these  walls not seem so close or so strong  or so cold..." (to Merlin/Jumpy) Women live for this stuff. (reads on) Dreaming 'bout your this, dreaming  'bout your those, gettin' X-rated on  me here, Nicky... where are we...  oh, right, other side... (turns paper over) "Someday I'm gonna take you up by  Lake S. Before I went in, before  goddamn Millie, 'fore I had my  situation, I used to work up at this  casino, working security. Used to  watch for people stealing chips,  counting cards, getting piss-drunk,  that kinda shit. Indian place, they  hired this reject outta Vegas to run  it, got about as much business sense  as a buffalo patty. Anyways, it's a  fun place to run some numbers and  play."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel puts the letter down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good writer, Nick. I give  this writing an A-plus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never worked at no casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hopeless) Nick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy steps out of her hold and stalks forward:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the guy I was in with, I did  my last ten months with him. He rode  a two-year bit for manslaughter --  split a guy's skull open at a bar  for harassing his girl. That's Nick  Mason. He worked at that casino.  He's the one who wrote her letters.   Me, I'm a damn mechanic, my last job  was a Quickie Lube, I did five for  lifting cars. I don't know shit about  blackjack, I don't know shit about  Indians. I'm not him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel stares at him. Then crumples the letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bury this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin and Jumpy grab Rudy and THROW him from the truck. HITS the snowy parking lot on his side, hands bound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel, you promised!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promised that when he helped us,  we'd be gone! When he helped us!   Loverboy don't want to play!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin and Jumpy drop to the snow, picking Rudy up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You promised me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you promised me you'd get your  sweetheart to help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy meets eyes with Ashley. She's caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd rather die than be with you,  he'd make a fucked-up boyfriend  anyway. (to Merlin/Jumpy) Bury him all over the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She charges at her brother. Gabriel grabs her, spins her  into control and PUNCHES her in the jaw. She goes flying of the truck. HITS the ground hard. In shock. Merlin and Jumpy march Rudy across the lot. A stand of da and snowy woods ahead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beats prison, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK!!! NICK!!! NOOOOO!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy struggles, desperate but held firm. Jumpy loads a  handgun, as he muses for the very first time:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The problem with prison... is that  it is founded on the fundamentally  flawed perception of rehabilitation  through punishment. A society can't  hope to create a "changed man" by  surrounding him with the worst in  his fellow man; what it  "rehabilitates" is solely a conviction  that if he can survive the inhumanity  of prison, what then, can he not  withstand? He has seen man's darkest  soul and kept his sight: what is  left for such a man? What faith?  What fear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the woods' edge, Jumpy gives the gun to Merlin --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get no blood on my boots --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gun goes to Rudy's head. A bullet fills the chamber.  Ashley SCREAMS. Rudy shuts his eyes tight and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT DO YOU WANT TO KNOW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin and Jumpy stop. Ashley stops screaming. Gabriel tu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About the Tomahawk! What the hell do  you want to know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His guards look to Gabriel. Rudy nods, sweating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spend six months writing poetry  and my goddamn pen pal fucks me over.  Thanks for the stamps, Ash. You want  me, you got me. Whaddya want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley gasps relief. Gabriel smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin and Jumpy march Rudy back. Still on the ground:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you... Nick, I love you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy won't meet her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. She says she loves you, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She says a lot of things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's getting you to help us... 'cause  she knows if you don't, you're dead.  You just tell us what we need to  know, you two live happily ever after.   My sister loves you, motherfucker,  and I ain't gonna have you break her  heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wish I had a brother like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A girl says she loves you, you say  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy looks at Ashley. Her eyes plead forgiveness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had better sex in prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heyyy. Be nice, convict. We're gonna  be working together here. (to his boys) Get him back in the rig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin and Jumpy wrench Rudy backward. Ashley reaches out him, starts to speak. He looks right through her. She goe silent, casts her eyes to the snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not the guy, Monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks to the truck. Weasel-faced Pug has sidled  next to Gabriel. Spits some chaw. It hits Merlin's boots. Merlin growls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whole time you were driving, he was  telling her he's not the guy, he's  not the guy. I know why he'd tell us  he's not the guy. why's he telling  her he's not the guy? What if he's  not the guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel considers, jumps off the truck. Walks to Rudy:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man who wrote those letters loved  Ashley, boys. He lived for her love. (nods) Let's see him live for love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel puts a gun under Rudy's chin. Rudy flinches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's she work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forces gun harder) Wrote you a hundred letters, didn't  she? Where's she work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.C. Penney. Beauty and fragrances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's her middle name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking hard) Samantha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd they call her in high school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bam Bam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd they call her in college?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd she drop her cherry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Canada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be more specific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A station wagon in Canada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's her greatest fear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong, Nick. It's drowning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's her brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy stares him down. Gabriel shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the gun away. Ashley regains her breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get back on the road. It's  time to start talking, Nick. Time to  start telling tales --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick don't talk till Nick gets  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel gives a challenging stare. Rudy stares right back It's a showdown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot. Chocolate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trucker slowly smiles. His crew chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want that for here or to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I been in Iron Mountain for two years,  truck driver. I do one more crime,  I'm back there for good, so fuck you  and fuck your sister and fuck your  trucker friends. You want to hear  about some goddamn job of mine? I  want some hot-goddamn-chocolate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've stopped laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And some pecan-fucking-pie.

dialogues.speaker: HOT CHOCOLATE AND PECAN PIE
dialogues.text: The six of them sit in a booth, Ashley leaning on Rudy's  shoulder apologetically. The four truckers watch him scar his pie. "White Christmas" plays over the speakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when you worked there --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy raises a finger sharply. Silence. He continues eatin Scrapes the last of his pie crumbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew the place --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy stares hard. Gobbles the crumbs, washes it down with his hot chocolate. Savors it. Sets the mug down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know, I could really go for some  onion rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel nods to Jumpy, who snaps his arm up, SMASHING his knuckles into Rudy's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel! You said talk to him. That's  all you ever said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're talking, aren't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy holds his nose. Blood trickles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much money's in that casino?   Day-to-day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs, a guess) Five million?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wrote Ash that letter, you told  her that story 'bout working Christmas  Eve, bout how they'd send half the  security guys home, nobody comin, in  that night. And the rest of you got  shit-faced drinking hot buttered  rum. That a true story now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christmas... Eve...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know where the guards are. You  know how to get in and out. You know  where the money is. (nods) We're taking down that casino,  convict. You're the guy gonna tell  us how.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy turns slightly pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's... been two years --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got faith in you, Nick Mason. (smiles) You're our inside man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy slams in, letting the door smack shut behind him. It a tiny windowless closet. Rudy kicks a stall door, pacing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...goddamn it, Rudy... goddamn it...  goddamn girl, goddamn Nick... you're  so smart, so fucking smart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stalks a circle, grabs a sink, and stares at his refle in the mirror. He looks a wreck. He settles down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your Christmas dinner now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COUPLE leaves the booth behind Gabriel's crew. Pug and  Merlin reach over, steal their leftovers and dig in. Ashl fidgets. Jumpy regards the garlands painted on the windows beside:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've read where the retail industry  does fifty percent of its business  between December 1st and December  25th. Half the year's business, in  one month's time. It seems to me an  intelligent society would legislate  a second such gift-giving holiday,  create, say, a Christmas Two -- late  May, early June -- to further  stimulate growth and prosperity. For  who would protest such a holiday?  Taking the fifty percent model, a  Christmas Two would grow this  country's annual per capita income  by close to one-third.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stares at Jumpy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christmas Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Indian nods. Gabriel shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever since you started night school,  you been givin, me headaches, Jumpy.   Headaches. (to Merlin/Pug) Go see what's taking him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy crouches behind the door, a piece of iron pipe in hi grip, ready to strike. Listening... listening... AS the door SLAMS open, swinging fast and BASHING him in head. Rudy tags the floor, drops the pipe, knocked out. Merlin and Pug gaze down on him, shaking their heads. Pug spits tobacco. Hits Merlin's boots again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy's back, with a new facial bruise. Ashley reaches for his hand; he pulls it away. Gabriel unfolds a piece of pa it's a crude map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here ya go, convict. We cased the  place in the fall, got the layout  down. What you're gonna do is show  us where each of these doors go,  what the upstairs level looks like,  where they got the alarms, all of  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where they hide the real money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin exhales some smoke in Pug's face. Pug hacks, shove him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Nick? If you even think about  setting us up, giving us some bad  information? We go down... you go  down... (lets it settle) Now. Christmas Eve. How many guards  are there gonna be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy surveys the table. All five waiting for him. Sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell. Ten?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And which of these doors here lead  up to the security level?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel passes the map across the table. Rudy stares at i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start talking, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy's still staring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start talkin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell made this map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, who the hell made the map?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't the Tomahawk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the front entrance, right?   You get through the slots, you hit  craps here, not blackjack. Blackjack's  here to here -- lined up. What's  this, the cage? Cage is over there,  hard to get to, you got it all mixed  around --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what it looks like!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when? What the hell is this  room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buffet. Whaddya think it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buffet is by the goddamn bar! What  the hell kind of map is this?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel reaches across the booth, grabs Rudy's shirt, pul his face to table level:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We walked the place for a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I worked there. For a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither man blinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Map is kinda dirty, Monster...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They changed the layout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy nods, pretending to be dawned upon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They changed the layout -- whadda  they call you? Mr. Monster? They  remodeled the place. When I worked  there -- listen to me -- guy that  managed the joint, guy who ran it--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack. Jack Bangs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, Jack Bangs. Uh... guy was  always talking bout fixing the place  up. Maybe get a better crowd. Musta  gone and done it while I was in the  Mountain. (pushes map away) I don't know this map, man. How the  hell am I supposed to tell you what  door goes where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wouldn't have changed the  security setup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I worked there, this was Bangs,  office. Back here. He kept a little  safe in the... uh, the wall, money  held take for himself, skim from the  Indians. Called it the... uh... (stumbling) ...the Powwow Safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Powwow Safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His personal safe, he gave it a name.   Now you're telling me they've taken  his office, put the buffet there?   Then who knows what else they changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel stares at him, suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what the hell good are you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd have to get me inside. (carefully) Get inside, watch where the money's  moving, see where the guards are  going. Then I could work with your  map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong, convict. You walk in there,  they recognize you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They recognize him, they'll remember  him after the job goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't recognize me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me. They won't recognize me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll trust you when we're rich. Why  not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause you're gonna get me a disguise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy locks eyes with Gabriel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give you the wrong information,  you're gonna shoot me. Well, I don't  know your damn map. So you can either  find a way to get me in there... or  you can shoot me right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WAITRESS comes over, drops their check on the table. It rests near Rudy. Rudy locks eyes with Gabriel. And pushes the check his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "Motor City Monster" RUMBLES along a two-lane blackto Across barren Michigan tundra. A sign reads "You Are Now  Entering Powahachee Indian Lands. No Littering."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel drives, with Ashley beside him. Rudy sits in the  sleeper, Jumpy sitting guard.

dialogues.speaker: OUT THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: they pass a brightly neon-lit building, with a parking lo full of cars. The Tomahawk Casino, with a red neon axe  pointing the way. And a marquee which reads: "10X ODDS ON CRAPS. $5.95 PRIM

dialogues.speaker: RIB. PERFORMING TONIGHT
dialogues.text: The truck motors on by. Gabriel nods to Rudy:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring back some memories, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Midwestern castles-and-Camelot-themed chain hotel, amid an outcrop of roadside exit civilization: fast food and g The Great Lakes Trucking rig parked in the hotel's lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faux stonemasonry and torches. "Regal" purple carpets. Ga and his crew escort Rudy into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- his quarters. Jumpy marches Rudy to the bed, snaps a  handcuff around his ankle --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is this? What happened  to working together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and snaps the other cuff to the bedframe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rather be back in the Mountain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might as well be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't have Weather Channel in the  Mountain, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel tosses him a TV remote. Merlin rips the room's ph out of the wall, takes it. They return to the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
