dialogues.text: Sleep good, loverboy. Tomorrow you  got singing for your supper to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truckers leave. Rudy tugs at his ankle cuff, sighs,  collapses back on the bed. Ashley has remained. Rudy sits up, sees her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your own room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She approaches instead. Sits beside. Gently:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he wanted to talk to you.   When he found the letters... he said  "when your boyfriend gets out, I  wanna talk to him." I thought he  meant back in Detroit. I thought he  meant --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you knew why. Knew why, didn't  ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley stands her ground, guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we'd have a few more days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what? You to talk me into  "helping"? What, he promise you a  share of the winnings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, shit, Judas, you shoulda at  least gotten that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick! He wants to know how to rob  it, and he'll leave you alone! That's  all he wants! (breaking down) I hate him, Nick... you know how...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So get him outta your life. Get out  of Michigan. They got perfume counters  in Chicago, don't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches to touch him. Rudy turns his back on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when do some trucker pals start  thinking big, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run routes mostly east, retail  stuff, warehouses. But Gabriel knows  some guys in New York, Miami, guys  he helps get guns to Detroit. Hides  'em with his regular loads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He working for them on this one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He wants to be working for himself  someday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm his ticket. (considers) What's the last place they took down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel and his guys. What's the  last place they robbed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think they've ever robbed  anything before. I think they've  just driven guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy looks at her with new interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've never done a robbery?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) They're truck drivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the first time in a long time... Rudy smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then they do need me, don't they.   They really need me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna get out of here, Nick.   We're gonna get out of this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We? What "we"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy stares at her. The smile gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your own room, Ashley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your own room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley pulls away, walks to the door. Turns back, wanting say something, but Rudy's not even looking her way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'd told you what he wanted, you'd  have been gone. You'd have gotten on  that bus and stayed on it. And if  that's selfish, I am. If that's lying,  I'm a liar. But I been dealing with  fucked-up brother and his fucked-up  friends for a long time, and I was  stronger than him then and I'm  stronger than him now. 'Cause he  showed up for money. I showed up for  love. (hard) And if you're so ready to make me  your enemy... then what did you show  up for, Nick. What did you really  want... with me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a fiery look, she strides from the room. Rudy stands, can't get far cuffed to the bed. Checks the table, finds a Bible and a deck of cards. Out his second-floor window is a view of the rear parking lot. Rudy watches as a Chevy Blazer parks and two drunk FISHER get out. The truck's bumper sticker reads "Ice Fishermen It All Year Long." Rudy watches the good ol' boys stumble toward the hotel. turns back, surveys his new prison cell

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've never done a robbery... (nods) Christmas is looking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bed has been dragged to the door to the bathroom, the comforter and pillow are on the floor, "Miracle on 34th S is on the TV, and Rudy lies asleep on the ground, ankle s cuffed. Two SHADOWS fall across him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy is brusquely dragged out by Jumpy and Merlin, passin Ashley, who lies asleep in the hall, head on a pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having romance problems, Romeo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They march him onward. Rudy glances over his shoulder at  Ashley. Who spent the night at his door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wood-panelled room adjacent to a small indoor pool, wit arcade games and a dart board. Gabriel's with Pug, tossin darts, as Jumpy and a chain-smoking Merlin haul Rudy in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn, Merlin. There any part of  the day you don't smoke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There anytime you don't got a mouthful  of shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cancer-sucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acid-chewer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel THWAPS a dart into the board, to shut them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a look what Pug's bought for  ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pug empties a shopping bag on a pinball machine. Cowboy b spurs, a black cowboy hat, a black rhinestone jacket and longhaired wig tumbles out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cowboy. You're going to send me  into an Indian casino disguised as a  cowboy. Have you thought this entirely  through?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin and Jumpy shove Rudy toward the merchandise. Gabri slams another dart into the board, then turns:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a country-western singer up  from Nashville for the the holidays.  Visiting your Grandma on the lake,  driving into the Tomahawk for some  scotch and slots. You only play the  slots, you got that? Don't want no  dealer friend of yours recognizing  you, you sidle up to shoot some craps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of half-ass cowboy plays  the slots?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least gimme video poker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up. You play what your  girlfriend plays. Ashley's going in  with you. You talk to her, otherwise  you don't talk to nobody. You walk  the room as many times as you want,  but the second you come out, I want  to know the run of the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy examines his new hair and cowboy gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I get a country-western name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get recognized, convict, You get  a country-western funeral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chevy Nova crunches into the parking lot in the shado of the gaudy neon axe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy's in "disguise": paste-on goatee, tinted shades and  black cowboy gear. Very Nashville Network. He's wedged between Jumpy and Merlin, wearing handcuffs.  Gabriel, Ashley and Pug in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know what, guys? I woke up this  morning, I got a really lucky feeling  going on. I mean it, I'm feeling  that good. I wouldn't be surprised  if I walk in there, pull a handle  and hit jackpot. Hell, we wouldn't  even have to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy stamps feet, shivering in the cold, as Merlin unlock his cuffs. Gabriel reaches to help Ashley out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your goddamn hands off me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She edges toward Rudy, then stops. A chill still there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got one hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna need some money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel hands a bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten dollars? What do I do with ten  dollars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monster. If we're working together  here, we gotta be working together.  I can't walk in there looking like  the Lone Fucking Ranger with ten  bucks to throw down. You don't want  me getting noticed, right? Not getting  noticed costs a guy at least a couple  hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel glares, turns to his crew. Mutters, rubs his fing together. Merlin, Pug and Jumpy reach for their wallets,  grumbling. Gabriel takes a few twenties from each. Rudy nods thanks as Gabriel hands him the cash --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (threateningly) Don't. Lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy pockets the wad, hooks his elbow for Ashley to slip arm through. Grins with a drawl:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready to gamble, darlin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She regards him warily, but puts her arm in his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the boys) Y'all take care of my guitar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tips his hat, and strides for the casino entrance. Gab and his truckers watch them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grumbles) Who's robbin' who here, Gabriel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in there and watch 'em. Watch  their every fuckin' move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cascade of JINGLING and JANGLING COINS fills the brig lit, horrendously-carpeted space. Wooden-beamed ceilings  suggest a rustic theme, but the neon slots, lush green ta and red wheels of fortune are pure Midwest Vegas. The Tomahawk is tiny by Nevada standards, about the size a large bingo hall. This morning, about FIFTY GAMBLERS mi about. Skimpily-dressed COCKTAIL WAITRESSES, most of them Powaha Indians, pimp drinks. Bored DEALERS deal. As the sound of slot machine payoffs suddenly go silent -

dialogues.speaker: STEREO SYSTEM
dialogues.text: And some scattered cassettes, labeled "Big Winners," "Lit Winners," and "Medium Cash." A HAND pops the tape current in the system -- "Big, BIG Winners" and flips it over. Pr play. The sounds of JINGLING and JANGLING return.

dialogues.speaker: ON FULL SCENE
dialogues.text: An office overlooking the casino floor through smoked gla JACK BANGS, late 50's, silver-hair, capped teeth, shark s and high blood pressure, paces his office. He's got the a of a washed-up gameshow host, Wink Martindale, Peter  Tommarkin, one of those hacks. Right now he's all caffein

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an S-word I'd really like to  throw in the discussion here, guys,  cause it's a big part of what's going  on. Big element, 'kay? S-word. It's  a serious issue, serious factor, so  I'm just gonna get it out there,  throw it an out there, so we can  know it, we can talk about it, we  can get things done... (big pause) Snow. Are you with me, guys? Snow.  Big time, fucking, grade-A, God- quality, S-N-O-W-snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two INDIAN GOVERNORS sit before him. Business-dressed, wi overcoats, ponytails. One gray-haired, one jet-black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no snow in Vegas, 'kay? They  don't know it, they don't want it,  they got laws against the stuff.  They got Egypt down there, right,  they got Monte Carlo, Hawaii, they  got ancient Rome, but where's the  Winter Castle, right? Where's the  Swiss miss Chalet? Where's the Big  Fucking Igloo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We understand you, Mr. Bangs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Capades? They don't do it. Mittens?   Outlawed. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're aware of your position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picks up a chip) Because down there this is money.   Up here this is heat. (pleads) You wanted Vegas quality, I brought  it to you. You wanted Vegas press, I  gave it to you. But guys, please,  guys... I can't get you Vegas  profits... till one of ya does some  spirit dance and does something about  this snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tribal governors stare him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We understand the Paiutes' casino  saw a net profit of twelve million  dollars last year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Paiutes, they cook their books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waitela reservation made seventeen  million.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sobers) Seventeen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you have researched this,  Mr. Bangs. Is the snowfall on our  side of the lake that much greater  than the snowfall on theirs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack Bangs stares at them both. Considers his next move -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm bringing in this great showroom  act next week; these three Russian  girls, they look like Meryl Streep,  they can juggle anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bangs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys. We're doing it right, here.  $5.99 prime rib? Nobody does that in  Michigan. Nobody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tribe is concerned that many of  your... new ideas are not resulting  in any new venues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm putting liquor in the drinks,  I'm giving 10-times odds on craps, I  got the girls showing sixteen-percent  more skin! Show me another buffet's  gonna offer you Coke and Pepsi!  Whaddya want me to do?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want to see our casino making  money again, Mr. Bangs. Making money  for our community.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the Paiutes and the Waitela.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young man stands, stares Jack Bangs in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want you doing the job... that we  brought you here to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy and Ashley move away from a change booth, with a buc of quarters. Rudy messes with his cowboy getup, noting tw SECURITY GUARDS punch a code in a private door, step insi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So does it look a lot different?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here and there. Restaurant, uh, that's  the main expansion. Tables've been  moved around; the big man's office,  I dunno, might be upstairs now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They settle at a slot machine. Another SECURITY GUARD wal past them. Rudy turns his back. Ashley notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy knows you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, uh. Mike. That's Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the door, Merlin and Jumpy enter, wandering through th slots. Rudy sees them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You start spending your brother's  money. I'm gonna take a circuit around  the joint, check for any new ins and  outs. I'll snag us some drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he strides away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) Be careful, Nick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with Rudy, ambling among the tables, making a show of che out the layout. In reality, he's surveying the GAMBLERS. Passing the cage, he walks right by Jack Bangs and the In governors. Jack Bangs is all smiles, while the governors  turn their backs an him and storm out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couple rum and Cokes, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want that rum and Coke or rum  and Pepsi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy gives him a strange look. The bartender shrugs. Rudy still scans the tables, settling on --

dialogues.speaker: A BLACKJACK TABLE
dialogues.text: where a trio of COLLEGE KIDS are forking over chips. One them's dark-haired with a goatee, a sweatshirt and jeans. Rudy studies this kid for moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a goddamn bottle of anything.

dialogues.speaker: BACK AT THE BAR
dialogues.text: Jack Bangs sidles up, distraught. The barkeep hands him a bottle. Bangs takes a swig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go back to Vegas, Bear.  They'll fuckin' kill me, 'kay? I  can't go back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does the tribe want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want gold-paved roads is what  they want. Talking 'bout the fuckin'  Paiutes. Fuckin' Paiutes are on the  interstate. Nothing I can do about  that, man, I didn't pick the spot  for your reservation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither did we.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy gets his drinks, as Jack Bangs turns his way:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Hey, cowboy. Jack Bangs, I run  the place. Nice to have you in the  Tomahawk. Tell me something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy winces, glancing to see Merlin and Jumpy watching hi Frowns on their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...does upstate Michigan need another  roadside casino or does upstate  Michigan need an international gaming  destination?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wants outta here) Roadside casino?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack Bangs, smile falls flat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, so how'd you hear about this  place, then. Word-of-mouth? Mass  mailings? Cable TV?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prison?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy shrugs, smiles, takes off with his drinks. Bangs loo sick, turns to a FAT GUY on the next stool over. But befo he can ask, the guy shakes his head --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just stopped in to use the can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bangs turns to the bartender, puts his head in his hands:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go back to Vegas, Bear... I  can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the slots, we hear a JACKPOT PAYOFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw fuck.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE TABLES
dialogues.text: walks Rudy, as Merlin sidles up next to him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was that about --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't recognize me. Back off,  willya? He didn't recognize me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin eyes him darkly, but lets him walk on into the slo As he nears Ashley, he glances to the blackjack table, wh the College Kid has left... heading for the bathroom --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Nick! We're up fifty cents!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and as a barely-dressed COCKTAIL WAITRESS crosses betw Rudy and Ashley, blocking her view of him -- Rudy pretends to crash into her, splashing the rum and Co into his own face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heyyyy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaching Ashley, his goatee is dripping --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, what happened --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There went my... damn... well, doesn't  seem like security's all that  switched... Ash, shit, this mustache  is starting to fall off. I gotta fix  this thing -- (hands her his glass) -- drink this for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hustles for the bathroom. A moment later, Jumpy storms by. Stops at Ashley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He started losing his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The College Kid is zipping up when Rudy SLAMS into his ba money in hand, crashing him against the wall:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundred bucks to wear this jacket --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, man, don't kill me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's killing you, kid. Santa's  giving you a rhinestone jacket and a  hundred bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin's at a slot machine, watching the hall to the  bathrooms. A WAITRESS arrives, hands him a beer:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, sister. How are ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' freezing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yeah. You work here long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five years. Since it opened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long ago was your makeover?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My what?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, the place. The remodeling. moving  everything around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waitress frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tomahawk's looked the same since  I started, mister. (shrugs) Only the losers change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin stares at her. Then drops his drink to the floor,  charging for the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Merlin crashes in, seeing the cowboy hat and jacket, b turned, adjusting a belt. As the figure turns around. It's the College Kid. Merlin stops in his tracks -- -- as Rudy CRASHES into him from a stall, kicking his leg out, driving his throat into a countertop. Merlin hits th ground, gagging. Rudy wears the kid's sweatshirt:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GO! GO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The College Kid, shaking, hustles out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the College Kid, in Rudy's black getup, strides out of the bathroom hall, walking for the casino exit. From the slots, Ashley and Jumpy glance up, seeing him go From their vantage, it looks like Rudy. They frown. As they're watching the Kid hit the door, Rudy darts out the hall, heads the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel and Pug sit sentry, seeing the cowboy figure leav the casino. wandering into-the parking lot... away from t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell's he going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell's your sister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the figure unlocks the driver's door of a Trans Am --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pug REVS the engine, speeds through the lot, cutting off Trans Am from backing away. Gabriel jumps out, HAULS the cowboy from his car and sees it's the College Kid. Rudy's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scared shitless) Oh man. It's your jacket, isn't it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin stumbles out of the bathroom, holding his throat.  Catches Jumpy and Ashley's eyes from the slots:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Rudy charges toward COOKS, holding a buffet plate alof

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEDIUM RARE?! You call this MEDIUM  RARE                        !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- hands them the plate, hurries past them, and out the -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- to the back of the building. In his stolen clothes, he charges across the staff parking area and into the snowy  expanse of meadow beyond. Running for a thicket of winter woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin and Jumpy stride out to join Gabriel and Pug. Ashl follows, stumbling to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the HELL did he go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monster. There never was a structure  change. This place was built the  same from day one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That motherfucker --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Monster... he was talking with  the casino manager. Nick was talking  to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel darkens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get. Him. Back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy races as best he can through the waves of snow. He k struggling, losing his footing, fighting his way toward t cover of trees. From far away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick! Run! RUN!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy turns back to see Merlin, Jumpy and Pug round into v back at the parking lot. They see him. And charge into the snowfield. Rudy breaks into the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel pushes Ashley into the Nova and peals out of the  parking lot. Onto reservation roads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy darts among barren oaks and brush pines, crunching d into snowdrifts, slowing him down. Stumbling forward,  shivering, breath frosting -- -- as Merlin, Jumpy and Pug reach the treeline. Gaining b struggling too. With guns held. Rudy keeps battling through the drifts -- -- as GUNSHOTS start to ring out. Rudy glances back to re the truckers are a hundred yards distant. But as he turns struggle on, treebark SPLITS apart beside him. Rudy keeps running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bouncing over a snowy dirt road, having found a shortcut  into the woods. Gabriel searches the trees, Ashley too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin, Jumpy and Pug keep up their steady march. Rudy's  running figure now only fifty yards distant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep running, Nick! Keep running  now! Can't keep warm if you don't  keep running! We'll just be right  back here... keeping track of your  trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE to show Merlin's striding right in Rudy's bootprint Pug FIRES off two shots. They KICK UP snow just behind Rudy, struggling, panting..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wherever you run... we'll get there.  Fast as you want... we'll be there.   We drive for a living, Nick. Twelve,  fifteen, twenty-hour days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy's anguished, ducking behind some pines, trying to br away his footprints. Realizes it's useless. A BULLET whistles through the pine branches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got nothing but time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy takes a breath, crashes onward -- -- then stops at the sound of a RUMBLING. Getting louder. Closer. It's a car's engine. Rudy spins for the source, focuses, and manages to make o a snow-covered dirt road fifty yards away, down a swale.  Another BULLET smashes treebark. Rudy runs for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Rudy leaps out to wave down the car, as around the cor comes a Chevy Nova -- -- with Gabriel and Ashley inside. Gabriel's eyes widen, floors the gas, RACING right for Rudy. Rudy scampers toward the opposite roadside, a steep woode slope cradling a meadow and frozen river --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as Ashley grabs Gabriel's steering wheel, swerving the other way. Gabriel fights her for control -- -- as the Nova just misses Rudy, who dives off the road,  hits the slope and tumbles head-over-heels toward its bot a hundred feet down, kicking up geysers of snow! On the road, the Nova skids to a stop. Ashley and Gabriel leap out, as Merlin, Jumpy and Pug reach the road.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE SLOPE'S BOTTOM
dialogues.text: Rudy pops to his feet, a dazed snowball.

dialogues.speaker: BACK UP AT THE ROAD
dialogues.text: Gabriel grabs a rifle from the Nova, steps to the slope-t edge and takes aim --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUN!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as Ashley suddenly slams into him from behind -- Sending the both of them tumbling down the slope! Sliding and tangled, the rifle flying from Gabriel's grasp --

dialogues.speaker: TO THE BOTTOM
dialogues.text: -- where they come to a tangled, snowy halt. Gabriel stru to clear the ice from his face -- -- as the butt of his rifle cracks him in the jaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's for reading her mail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He extends a hand to Ashley --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and hauls her to her feet. Ashley beams. As Gabriel ho the two of them scramble away from the woods, Rudy with t rifle, toward the meadow and its frozen pond. More GUNSHOTS ring as Merlin, Jumpy and Pug slide their w down the ravine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy and Ashley race out across the ice. The traction's  slippery, but there's no way around. There's a highway br two hundred yards away, with sparse truck traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We get to the bridge, we're all right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, the ice is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get to the bridge! (waving at traffic) HEY! HEY! DOWN HERE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grips her hand tighter, as SHOTS crash into the ice at their feet. Suddenly, the ground splinters and gives way -- and Ashley goes plummeting through to the river! She  vanishes from sight in an instant! Rudy scrambles back, onto sturdy ice. He stares, stunned, the ripples in the freezing water. Ashley's not coming up.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Looks to the truckers in pursuit. Coming down the ridge. Then the highway. Safety within sight. But he can't run. Cursing himself, he grips the rifle tig and LEAPS into the ice-hole --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- plummeting underwater, the temperature hitting his bod like needles. He writhes, spinning around -- -- and sees Ashley ten yards away, desperately pounding a the ice above her. Strength giving out. Rudy struggles to her, wrapping an arm around her. She fi panicked, clawing at the ice, both of them pulled further away from the opening. With Ashley safely in hand, Rudy raises his rifle-arm,  pressing the barrel against the ice above them -- -- and FIRES. A HOLE blasts a shaft of light into the gra blue. Rudy FIRES again. Another HOLE caves in. Ashley rea for a sheath of ice, splashing --

dialogues.speaker: TO THE SURFACE
dialogues.text: -- clutching frozen ground, treading water. Rudy surfaces beside her, the both of them gasping, facing the bridge. Instinctively, they spin around --

dialogues.speaker: TO FIND GABRIEL, MERLIN, JUMPY AND PUG
dialogues.text: -- standing right behind them. Guns trained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rubs his jaw) At the rate you're going, Nick...   I'm gonna have a hard time ever  considering you family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He extends his hand, a gesture of help. But menacing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How lucky ya feeling now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pitch black. We can barely make out a huddled, fetal form quaking and trembling. It's Rudy. Dripping wet, on the ve of hypothermia. Trying to stay conscious:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-I-I-I have n-n-no g-g-gifts to br- br-bring, pa rum-p-p-p-p-p (struggling) ...pum-pum-pum. N-n-no treasures for  the k-k-k (waits) ...king.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trailer doors swing open, crashing harsh light upon h He squints into the light, shivering madly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pa-rum-pum-pum-pum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel is hurling darts again, focused, expressionless.  Bullseye. Merlin and Jumpy haul Rudy in. He collapses at Gabriel's  feet, unable to stand. Still trembling. A couple KIDS scamper into the doorway --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Game room's closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and Merlin slams the door in their face. Gabriel hurls another bullseye, then retrieves his darts from the board

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A for effort, Nick, honestly, A for  effort and an honorary degree. I'm  surprised you never escaped from the  Mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teeth chattering) ...never... tried...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, here's what we're gonna do. In  the spirit of the season, I'm going  to give you a chance. I understand  you're unhappy. Right outta the  lockup, here against your will, it's  the holidays and there's reruns on  TV. (beat) So we're gonna have a contest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel strides back to him, with two darts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're each going to get one of these.  Whichever one of us hits closer to  the bullseye... gets what he wants. (beat) You land closer, you get Ashley.   And you guys get to go free. I land  closer... and we start getting your  help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts Rudy's shaking hand, puts a dart in it. Rudy's  fingers are half-frozen, they don't bend. Gabriel has to  wedge it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May the best sportsman win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel turns to the board, ten feet away, and tosses his dart. It thunks in the "13" wedge of the outermost ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps aside for Rudy. Rudy struggles to raise his hand trembling badly. He focuses on the board, teeth chatterin tries to reposition his fingers, rears back and throws -- -- except the dart remains in his frozen grip. He brings icy hand back, tries to move his fingers. And the dart fi tumbles out and hits the floor at his feet. Gabriel smiles, steps close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got something to say to me, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...ttt..tt... two out of three?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel grabs his jacket and hurls him backward. Rudy CRA into a chair, flanked by video games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you tell that casino manager?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nnn... nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were talking to him! What'd you  tell him!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing... I promise-nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAYBE SOMETHING ABOUT A ROBBERY?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel spins to the dartboard, pulls out a fistful and  wheels. He whistles a dart at Rudy's head. it SMACKS the  wall beside his ear. He whistles another. It TRUNKS right above his head. A th HITS the wall by his chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thought I was some gambler... he  didn't know me... he didn't recognize  me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I been driving rigs a long time,  Nick. Four, five million miles of  road. Worked for people who wouldn't  keep me on less I was driving fifteen  hours a day. Tell 'em I needed sleep,  I needed rest, shit, they'll hire  someone else...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel flings another dart. Just misses Rudy's other ear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Dispatcher's screaming for me to  haul ass, he's got a load on the  runback for me. Shipper's making me  wait for the pickup, receiver's  bitching 'bout the count...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another dart NAILS the wall, right through Rudy's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Got the cops at the bottom of  every mountain, got the DOT at the  top. And every day, every day, I see  all those faces in their little airbag  Hot Wheels, moms and pops and jam- faced kiddies, giving me that look  to go to hell and get off their happy  goddamn highway. Hey. They don't  gotta get two thousand miles by  sundown, or the gang don't eat come  sunrise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel strides to Rudy, sitting stock-still, his head ri by darts. Stares him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time for me... to be working  for me. I want mine, Nick. And I  need you. (frightening calm) Did you tell your manager there's  gonna be a robbery?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Gabriel... no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel pulls the darts free. Backs away again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...he... he asked me... how I'd heard  about his place... he didn't know it  was me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I PROMISE YOU HE DIDN'T KNOW IT WAS  ME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and then lowers it. Believing he's gotten a reprieve,  Rudy relaxes, his shivering coming under control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, Monster... just... just don't  start trying to hit me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick. I been trying to hit you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel rears back and WHISTLES another dart. It plugs in Rudy's chest. Rudy screams. Gabriel FIRES another, skewer him in the ribs. Then a third, fourth and fifth. Rudy howls in pain, his body too numb to defend itself. F darts protrude from his chest, colorful plastic featherin and spreading rivulets of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that'll help sharpen your  memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel stalks close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight we're gonna take another  look at that map. And this time you're  gonna tell me what I need to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy gets hurled inside by Merlin and Jumpy. He hits the  floor beside the bed, where Ashley sits prisoner. Pug sit guard, watching "How The Grinch Stole Christmas" on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick! Jesus, Nick --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She falls to his side. Merlin cuffs Rudy's ankle again to the bedframe. He and Jumpy head out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pug's engrossed in the cartoon. They're singing in Whovil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUG!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pug snaps to. Shuts off the TV, spits some chaw on the fl and gone. Rudy and Ashley are left alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, oh my God, what'd he do to  you? What'd he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She touches his bloodied chest. Rudy winces badly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had some points to make...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley helps pull his shirt off, sees the wounds:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, stay here, don't move,  stay right here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (near-delirium) All I wanted... was to make it home...  for a little of Dad's turkey, and  Mom's stuffing... Aunt Lisbeth's  acorn gravy... Aunt Mary's cranberry  buns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley has leapt to the bathroom. She brings wet washclot back to clean and dress --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get there, baby... we'll get  there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Haven't had cranberry buns... in  five whole years...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh, now. Rest now. Two years, Nick.  You haven't had cranberry buns in  two years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him softly. Rudy meets her eyes. Staring to ge his bearings back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saved my life. (beat) You could have run, but you didn't.  You saved me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saved me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saved you because I love you, Nick. (smiles) Why'd you save me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy studies her hopeful face, attending to his wounds. s weak and distant:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy I was in with... car thief... I  used to read your letters to him. I  know they were private... I know,  but... you spend twenty-four hours a  day with somebody, you gotta talk,  y'know? You gotta share. Or the room  gets even smaller. (beat) And sometimes, I'd be reading them,  and he'd close his eyes, get a smile  on his face... and I'd know somewhere  inside he was pretending you were  writing to him -- He'd see your face,  your pictures on the wall... (beat) Some nights I think he fell in love  with you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy touches a hand to her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave a couple guys hope, Ashley.   And with hope, there ain't nothing  you can't survive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley stares, touched, still kneading the cloth into his chest. Rudy struggles up, his face level with hers. She kisses h tenderly. Lingering. And this time Rudy responds, mouth seeking, working down neck. Her eyes flutter closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Nick... I'm so sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say my name...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Nick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash. Don't say it. Don't say my name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley hesitates. Carefully strokes his chest. He's still kissing her, softly, still somewhat delirious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a small frown) I love you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he returns to her lips, mouths joining. Ashley's eyes  close again, as they fold into each other... ...and move slowly, tenderly, back to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bitter cold sunset. Through a room's window, Rudy and A lie tangled in sheets on the carpet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley nestles against him. Rudy stares skyward. Hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll have guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said they've run guns, in their  trucks. So they'll have guns. To do  this robbery. They'll have serious  guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll need one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley frowns. There's a new look in Rudy's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to have to be inside that  casino. When it happens. I'll need  to be part of it. I can't just be  drawing some map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, what are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to find a way to make me  part of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part of... with them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy meets her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we're helping them with their  robbery, we're gonna be doing more  than just walking away. Like that's  some Christmas bonus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods, scheming the way he's always known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want him outta your life? You  want a real New Year to look forward  to? (bravely) If we're gonna do this... we're gonna  do it to get it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A medieval-themed biergarten. A happy FAMILY of five sits a booth, singing along to "Good King Wencelas." In the booth beside, Merlin and Pug are holding court.  Merlin's puffing smoke rings. Pug watches dully, chewing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knew a guy in Joliet, smoked ten  packs a day like you. His lungs got  so black they couldn't find 'em with  an x-ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That right? Shit. I used to run rigs  for a guy loved your chaw there.  Shit rotted out his tongue, had to  build him one outta silicon so the  poor boy could talk. You ever see a  motherfucker with a silicon fucking  tongue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Happy Family stops singing. Pug considers, spits a wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell. The guy from Joliet, those  black-ass lungs were the least of  his problems. Got so much smoke in  him his lungs couldn't even hold it.  Got into his system, man. Into his  blood. Coming out his ears, man,  coming out his eyes. Guy'd be walking  the row, smoke'd be puffing out his  skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Happy Family trade discomfited looks. Merlin shrugs,  takes another drag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This trucker? Met a girl in a bar  one night, she didn't know his  situation. He's drunk, she's drunk,  they get to mackin' hot and heavy  and the woman swallows it. His tongue.  Sucks it right down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My guy would walk into a room, set  off the goddamn sprinklers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His lips went next. You ever see  some silicon-fucking-lips?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Happy Family flees their booth. Pug and Merlin glance over. And grab their leftovers. Rifling the grub:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with disgust) Vegetarians...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind them, Gabriel and Jumpy file into the biergarten,  leading Rudy and Ashley to the booth. Meeting commenced. Rudy, battered and freezer-burnt, gets shoved in first.  Gabriel throws down the casino map:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no gifts to bring, pa-rumpum- pum-pum

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sing it in pictures, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy takes the map, glances at Ashley, and then takes cha For the first time, he's giving the orders:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you gotta worry about first is  the guards. Place doesn't look much  richer than when I worked there, so  let's figure you're gonna have to  deal with ten of 'em. There'll be  two on the floor, walking the room,  that leaves eight up above. Eyes in  the sky. They see something up,  they're the ones who'll hit the silent  alarm and you're fucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we take them out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta get someone upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy takes the map, points to the gaming tables area:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across from blackjack, there's a  security doorway. Keypad access.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the code?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... they change it every month. I  wouldn't know. (beat) If there's trouble on the floor,  you'll get security coming through.  what you gotta do, is get inside  that doorway once they do. You gotta  draw 'em out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without having them hit the alarms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got an idea on that one. Once you're  up there, you gotta hold those guards  down till some backup can get there.  There's a security camera room that  videotapes everything. You've gotta  destroy every last one of those tapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lock down security, you move  behind the cage. You hit the Count  Room. There'll be a guy in there but  he's got no guns; room's accessed by  another code. Cashiers'll know it.  They'll have alarms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the Powwow Safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Powwow Safe. The secret safe.   You said the manager's got a safe in  his office where he hides skim money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Right. Yeah. That's, uh upstairs.  Uh. Here. Powwow Safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His confident manner wavers. Gabriel notices, narrows his eyes. Rudy quickly grabs the map again:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. You're gonna need a man through  here, two men at the cage, one to  cover the count. You're gonna need a  lookout outside, a sweeper through  the back, and a gun guarding the  front. (beat) You need six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got five. Putting Ashley outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel eyes him darkly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go in with five, you're either  leaving an alarm free or an exit  free. Someone hits an alarm, you're  fucked. Someone gets to a phone,  gets outside, 'cross the street,  whatever, you're fucked. You need  six. (nods) Six is me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys get caught, I go away for  good. I got an interest in making  sure you don't. You need a sixth man  covering an exit. What're you gonna  do about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. What're you gonna do about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts an arm around Rudy, smiles. That's her man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a map of that security level.   Every room, every guard, every thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six men means six guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm no threat without a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There'll be people in that casino.   I can't keep them from leaving if I  don't get a gun. I don't need bullets,  Monster... but I gotta be a threat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, Gabriel? This is  what you wanted him for, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel's eyes don't leave Rudy's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. What you guys have to plan  out, then... is how you're going to  get to that cage and that security  level before anybody realizes  anything's wrong. Running in with  ski masks and bullets flying ain't  gonna do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That part, Nick... was planned out  the day I read your letters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What. We all gonna dress up like  cowboys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not cowboys, Nick. Not cowboys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not on Christmas Eve.

dialogues.speaker: STORAGE LOC
dialogues.text: Pulled open to reveal FIVE SANTA CLAUS SUITS, hanging sid by-side. Red polyester coats and pants, white felt trim a black buckles, black boots and red caps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Gabriel lifts a Santa Claus suit and presses it agains Rudy. Ashley, Merlin, Jungy and Pug look on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Tis the season, convict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the suit back in the locker, pulls another. Findi Rudy's size.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't be attracting attention, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, we walking in there and  delivering toys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to see Merlin open another locker. This one stac with rifles, carbines and handguns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SKETCH
dialogues.text: of a floor plan, a sheet of paper overlaid on Gabriel's m of the casino. A pencil draws a boxy room and labels it  "Security Video Room." Then an eraser wipes it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: still cuffed to the bedframe, pulled close to a desk. He' sitting, working on the security level map. The door opens; Ashley enters, looking worried:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to see your map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm almost done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says he wants it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he wanted a photographic memory,  he shoulda kidnapped one. I'm working  on it here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley walks over, puts her arms around his neck. Whisper

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are we gonna do this, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the getaway girl. The money's  gonna get to you eventually. Gonna  be my job to be the guy who walks  outta there with it. But I can't do  that without a gun. Any luck talking  to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullets or no bullets, he won't do  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there any way you could get into  his truck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need a gun, Ash. We need a gun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy studies his map, then quickly pencils in the "Securi Video Room," in a totally different place than he drew it before. Hands the paper to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the Picasso. Is he in his  room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all are. Football's on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, thinks) Keep 'em there for a little while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley takes the map, frowns. Rudy kisses her gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna get you out of Detroit,  Ash. Get you out of beauty and  fragrances. (smiles, then) Remember that. After all this is  over, when you know me, when you  really know me... remember it was  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She searches his eyes, not quite understanding. But smile Rudy smiles back, nods toward the door. Ashley slips out. When she's gone, Rudy stands and turns to the window. Out the Blazer with the "Ice Fishermen Do It All Year Long" b sticker still sits parked. Rudy reaches for his jeans pocket, and pulls out-one of t game room darts, flecked with blood.

dialogues.speaker: HE GIVES IT A SOLEMN STARE
dialogues.text: INT. RUDYS ROOM - MOMENTS L&TER - NIGHT Rudy lies on his back, under the bed frame, dart in hand. tears off the plastic feathering, to get at the cross-sha end, furthest-from the tip. Four protruding metal edges. He finds the Phillips screws on the bedframe, and tries t work the dart-end into the grooves. It scrapes and jags, with pressure he's able to do a quarter-turn at a time. The screw starts spiraling out.

dialogues.speaker: BEDFRAME
dialogues.text: As two metal pieces split apart, and Rudy wriggles his an handcuff off the frame.

dialogues.speaker: CLOSET
dialogues.text: As Rudy's hand grabs a paper-covered wire hanger and rips the paper off, untwisting the wire.

dialogues.speaker: ROOM'S WINDOW
dialogues.text: As Rudy slides it open, and climbs outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light snow falling. Rudy drops from the second floor wind into some snowy shrubs and an empty parking space. He  stealthily darts ahead to the ice fishermen's Blazer.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE FISHERMEN'S BLAZER
dialogues.text: Rudy peers in the windows, spotting fishing rods, tackle gear boxes in the back seat. He takes his wire coat hanger, now stretched straight, an slips it between the driver's window and moulding, jammin it around until it trips the door lock. The lock pops up; Rudy pops in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and raids the gear box. Bait, reels, fishing wire. Bon knives. A compass. A first aid kit. A switchblade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gun, gun, c'mon, boys like you gotta  be keeping a gun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rustles around in the backseat. Ice cooler, open bag o pork rinds, another gear box. Nothing. Some HEADLIGHTS sweep past the Blazer. Rudy ducks down,  pockets the switchblade. Munches some pork rinds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy scrambles out, heads to try another car, a pickup tr And then suddenly drops to the ground, seeing

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN AND JUMPY
dialogues.text: stride outside, talking casually, kicking snow on their w toward the Nova. Voices too low to hear.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCENE
dialogues.text: Rudy crouches behind the pickup, slips around the other s Merlin and Jumpy walk right by him. Rudy criss-crosses through the parking lot, hidden by car heading away from his room's window. His window. Rudy gla back to see if the truckers notice that, but they don't s to. They stand at the Nova, talking. Rudy shivers, waiting. They're not leaving. When their ba turn, Rudy dashes twenty feet to the cover of the buildin He slips around the corner, out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: AROUND THE SIDE OF THE HOTEL
dialogues.text: Rudy hops through snowdrifts, pressed to the wall, moving toward a side entry -- -- when he stops, hearing a woman's LAUGHTER. Above his head are a row of windows. Reflections of rippl water on the ceiling inside. It's the hotel pool behind t wall. Sounds of SPLASHES. Murmured VOICES. Rudy stands absolutely still. His breaths stop frosting.  Because his breathing has stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy creeps down the darkened hall, past a sign that read "Pool CLOSED. Open 9 am to 9 pm, No Lifeguard on Duty." Rudy steps closer, back to a wall, standing in shadow. Th small pool becomes visible, flickering blue water. From a unseen end, a figure splashes backwards into view -- It's Ashley. Hair wet, naked beneath the surface. Smiling and splashing someone offscreen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and he's saying "We're not gonna  help him just to walk away. If we're  gonna help him... we're gonna get it  all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She splashes again. Taunting --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...he wants to help now, he wants to  rob it now we could probably stay  right here, he'd go on and rob it by  himself --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Gabriel steps into view, also undressed, moving toward her in the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, baby. He wants me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel reaches her, puts his arms around her. She smiles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants... your "sister"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...whoever she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they kiss, entwining together, reflections and ripple A steamy embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick Mason's gonna help us more than  we ever dreamed.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: in the shadows, hearing them. Staring into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE POOL
dialogues.text: Gabriel turns with Ashley, wrapped together. Moving slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All those letters are about to pay  off, baby... all those letters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To all those cons...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Searching for a money man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We musta written what, twenty of  'em? And they were before this guy.   One, two letters apiece, ten to the  racetrack guy in Leavenworth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- till he fucked his parole --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- plus the forty to Mason... how  many letters is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a book, baby. (presses closer) That's a book of love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss again. Gabriel strokes her wet hair:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't take watching you touch him.   I can't take his hands on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more day, baby. One more day to  Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been doing good, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't have to hit me so fucking  hard. Didn't have to throw me outta  the goddamn truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't have to send me down a fucking  mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, he should see me help you catch  him?

dialogues.speaker: ON RUDY
dialogues.text: still in the shadows, welling with betrayal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's shown us the setup, he's drawn  us the map, he's helped us do the  plan. He wants a gun, give him a  gun. Take the bullets out, whatever,  but give him the gun. The more  manpower we've got in there, the  better. He won't try and make his  move till the money's in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be dead when he does.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE POOL
dialogues.text: Gabriel and Ashley rock slowly, coupled, in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know something, baby? If you were  my sister? I'd still want to wake up  Christmas morning with you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm, baby. And I'd still want to be  the tinsel round your tree...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as their words turn to moans and murmurs...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SHADOWS
dialogues.text: Rudy is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy strides a corridor, eyes dead ahead, passing a stair on his way toward the "Exit" sign posted above a door. He almost there, marching fast --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's my present to you, truck  drivers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell's Gabriel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and Rudy dives to the stairwell, out of sight just as  Merlin and Jumpy stride back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his girlfriend. Making up for  "Nick" time. I'm going down to the  bar, you want something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me a brew. I'm gonna check on  our convict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They separate, Jumpy down the hall, Merlin to the stairs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin trudges upward, while Rudy steps from hiding one f down. Checks the hall for Jumpy, then races out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy slams out the side door, scrambling straight for the same Blazer. He jimmies the lock again, leaps in, tears f the engine panel and searches for ignition wires like a p Stripping the plastic, trying to spark contact --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catch, dammit, catch! Like riding a  bike, it's like riding a bike!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's nothing. The engine won't start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin reaches the second floor, steps into the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy jumps from the Blazer, looks at the lot, the highway the woods. His own footprints in the dusting snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far you gonna get, Rudy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Realizing the answer, Rudy looks to his room's window. Fo to race back. He tries clambering the wall, standing an  shrubbery, but he can't reach. He whirls, desperate. And his eyes find the Blazer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin ambles the corridor. Approaching Rudy's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy flings open the Blazer door, slams the emergency bra down. Forces the gearshift into "Reverse."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin reaches Rudy's door. Searches his pockets for the  key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy darts to the front of the Blazer, slipping and slidi on asphalt ice. He drops to his knees, pushing on the fro bumper. The wheels start to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin finds a room key. Puts it in the lock. Turns the h but the door won't open. Merlin checks the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blazer starts to roll backwards, toward the snowy shr ringing the building. Headed for the empty parking space  below Rudy's window. Rudy keeps pushing. The Blazer picks speed, rolling on its own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin searches his pockets again, finds the right key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blazer rolls toward the building. Rudy scrambles to h feet, runs after it, leaps his left foot onto the bumper, the right foot onto the hood, then onto the roof -- -- getting two roof-steps worth of running start -- -- as the Blazer slows to a rest against the snowy shrubs -- and Rudy dives into the air, torpedoing himself right  through the window to his room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- where he crashes headlong to the floor, turning a  somersault and landing sprawled across the carpet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The key in the lock, Merlin hears the crash --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and as Merlin opens the door, he finds Rudy sitting ca on the floor, ankle-cuff locked once again to the bedfram Spreading a deck of cards out before him. Starting a game of solitaire. He looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin frowns, takes a suspicious look around the room. T window's open. Rudy continues his card game. Merlin watches him for a long time. Then pulls the door s Once he's gone, Rudy collapses to the floor. Breathing ha heart pounding. The cards go flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LIGHTS go out. Rudy creeps back to the window, checks outside... and stops still. In parking lot... ...a cigarette glow burns inside the Nova. From the drive seat. It's Merlin. Now watching. Rudy steps back into the shadows. Closing window and watc the falling snow. Caged again, after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pitch dark. Rudy asleep on the floor, as Ashley creeps ba in. Seeing he's asleep, she lies beside him, pulls a blanket  over them both, nestles into his body and kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas-Eve, my love. My  love, my love. Merry Christmas-Eve...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley closes her eyes. With a smile. A moment later, Rudy's eyes open. Turning to look at her  smiling, sleeping face... with a convict's vengeful stare

dialogues.speaker: DESK CLERK
dialogues.text: In a elfin cap, smiling cheerfully:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, gentlemen. And how can we  help you on this holiday morning?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL, MERLIN AND PUG
dialogues.text: Three grim faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three truckers stride to the Nova, where Jumpy guards Rudy and Ashley. In the b.g., the Ice Fishermen are by th car, wondering how the hell it switched parking spaces  overnight. Gabriel marches straight to Rudy and SLUGS him in the gut Rudy hits the snow --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's for the hundred bucks worth  of pay-per-view. (then KICKS him) And that's for the two hundred you  took outta your minibar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chokes, pained) You guys were paying for the room, I  just figured --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel KICKS him again, then pulls a handgun, points it Rudy's head. Ashley screams, rushes him -- -- as Gabriel's gun SHOOTS a thin stream of water into Ru face. It's a forty-five caliber squirt gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cruel smile) You wanted a weapon, convict? You  got one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel tosses the water pistol onto Rudy's chest. Jumpy Pug haul him up. With venom:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas-Eve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Motor City Monster cruises the snowy landscape, with  Lake Superior beyond. Pug drives the Nova in convoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel hands copies of Rudy's sketched map to Merlin and Jumpy. Rudy and Ashley are in the sleeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commit this thing to memory. Every  guard, every exit... don't tape it  to your fuckin, wrist: remember it.  That's the Gospel right there. The  Gospel. Matthew, Mark, Luke and  John...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy watches them studying his made-up map. Ashley stroke his arm, gives a loving smile. Rudy stares at her. He smiles right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rig and the Nova blow by a roadsign: "Now Entering  Powahachee Indian Reservation Lands."

dialogues.speaker: INT./EXT. TRAILER DAY
dialogues.text: The storage locker with the Santa suits SLAMS open. Merlin's hands PULL automatics and shotguns from the weap chest. Pug's hands UNLOAD ammo. A red-and-white Santa coat gets PULLED ON and BUTTONED UP Jumpy's hands apportion GUNS and AMMO on a picnic table. Black Santa boots STAMP TIGHT in the snow. A shoulder-strap ASSAULT RIFLE gets hidden under a Santa  coat. AMMO CLIPS are taped inside a fat black buckle-belt. A HANDGUN gets tucked under a Santa hat. And the rig's trailer doors come CRASHING SHUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lake Superior shimmers in the dying light. The rig's in t empty rest area lot. On a nearby bank, four men in Santa  Claus suits and one woman without sit scattered at picnic tables, guns at their sides. Staring out at the lake.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY AND ASHLEY
dialogues.text: sit apart from the rest. Rudy in a red suit, black boots, cap in hand. Ashley's head is in his lap, watching the sk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where should we go, Nick? When we're  gone from here... where should we  go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nova drives into the lot. Pug gets out, carrying seve fast-food bags. Hurrying to stay warm:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, who had the cheeseburger with  bacon; what about a roast beef, I've  got two roast beefs here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheeseburger 'n bacon's mine --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a bacon too; there another  bacon in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a bacon for him and a bacon  for me; there's four cheeseburgers  and two roast beefs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody better give me something  with some goddamn bacon --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they continue chow dispersal, Rudy stares over the lak Distant. Not even aware Ashley's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time right now... Dad's stacking  wood out back, getting ready for  tomorrow. Little blaze in the  fireplace. Mom's setting out the  good silver, hanging her cinammon  sticks, up in the doorways. Getting  out her scratchy old records...  singing along...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy smiles to himself. He's got a faraway look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where you're going.   But I'm going home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We go together, Nick. Wherever... we  go together. Remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. I'm going home.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: sits by the water, staring over the lake too. With a whit cotton Santa beard resting on his chin. He unwraps his ro beef sandwich, pulls his beard down to his neck, and take savage bite. Munches away, stares to Rudy and Ashley. She meets his ey Gabriel smiles. And looks again to the water.

dialogues.speaker: ON FULL SCENE
dialogues.text: The snowy rest stop, the glistening lake. And the six fig scattered, watching day turn to night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The neon axe lit up in full regalia, with Christmas light now strung along the building's roof. There are fewer tha dozen cars in the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filled with the JINGLING, JANGLING slots, but there's onl two FAT WOMEN sitting at them. Three INDIANS at a poker t An OLD TIMER in his 90's playing blackjack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ragged headquarters, looking down to the casino level  through smoked glass. Desks, file cabinets, pin-up  centerfolds. A room with video monitors to one side. Stai to a camera catwalk that rings the casino. Jack Bangs is at a table of wassail and cookies. He opens battle of brandy, pours a bit into the punch, and takes t bottle for himself. Walks over to his HEAD OF SECURITY,  watching the lack of activity below:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And all through the house... not a  creature was stirring... (sighs) Why don't you go ahead and send most  of your guys home, Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Jack. Merry X-mas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boss smiles, heads off. Jack Bangs swigs his brandy,  eyes his high-tech security gear glumly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell. Nobody even comes here to  cheat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nova pulls into the lot and parks. Merlin, Pug and As inside. On the road, the Motor City Monster slows to an i stop. In the cab, Gabriel turns to Rudy and Jumpy:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy gives Gabriel a withering look. He and Jumpy climb o Gabriel's rig rumbles up the road. [NOTE: All five men, save Ashley, from now till story's e are in their Santa Claus suits.]

dialogues.speaker: RUDY AND JUMPY
dialogues.text: make their way across the lot, heading for the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Jumpy, I want to ask you  something. You have any problem with  the fact that we're on our way to  take millions of dollars from an  Indian casino?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Native American considers. As they walk:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick. It's true that Indian gaming's  gone a long way toward restoring  wealth and pride to communities who've  been economically isolated and  enslaved for centuries. Stronger  infrastructure, better schools, higher  employment... they're all the results  of reservation casino success stories.  Still, many natives believe that  these are temples to a godless  materialism and greed that will only  infect the souls of indigenous peoples  until their love of money has  destroyed the spiritual values their  ancestors died to protect and their  homelands have become no different  from any United States suburb,  satellite city or industrial park.   Destroying the Indian legacy once  and for all and leaving behind a  nation of selfish, angry natives, of  which I, it's true, am one --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as they hit the Tomahawk's doors --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and SLAM inside, stumbling into each other, suddenly  LAUGHING and slapping backs. Surveying the casino:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey-hey, egg nog for everybody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy spreads his Santa arms wide and whoops. Jumpy laughs with him, steadying his balance. Drunken and slurred:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's win some MONEY! MONEY-MONEY-  MONEY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The few gamblers inside look up at the commotion. Bear th Bartender. Two CASHIERS and one WAITRESS. Ed the Security Boss strides over, smiling tightly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you gentlemen doing tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're out of work tonight, that's  how! Christmas Eve! We're out of  work!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his hand) Hi, Santa Claus, how are you. He's  with Sears, I'm with Wal-Mart, twas  the season...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all outta gifts, boys and girls,  but we got charitable donations!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy grabs a wad of bills from his pocket, drops some to floor. Jumpy retrieves them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...bunch of us got together for the  union party. Hey, how late are you  open?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes on the money) All night and all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got wampum for the Cocktail Waitress  Civil Defense Fund! Are there any  representatives here present?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Waitress sidles close; checks with the Boss. He nods ok

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I get ya, Santa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santa drinks American beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jumpy) What's your game, guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blackjack. Got a buddy from  Woolworth's out parking the sleigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Security Boss stares him down. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps aside and indicates the tables. Jumpy claps him the back, pushes Rudy on through the slots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel's truck at the roadside, hazards on, with signal  triangles as if broken down. Gabriel places the last one, hurries back down the casino road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
