dialogues.text: Ashley sits between Merlin and Pug. Gabriel jogs by the c Ashley checks her watch:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy and Jumpy sit at a blackjack table, beside the Old T Jovial ad libs as the Waitress brings Rudy's beer. Rudy  doubles down, busts, and gets belligerent: RUDY (to the Old Timer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was my card, pop!  My card! You hit for  my card! OLD TIMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... sorry, Mister... RUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was my king! OLD TIMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind them, Gabriel SLAMS through the casino doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woolworth's!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Sears! Hey, Wal-Mart!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saved you a seat, man. Get in on a  hand here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel sidles to the table, claps Rudy on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Old Timer) Careful. Watch out for this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They throw chips in. The Waitress circles around:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I get ya, Santa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: American beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Old Timer hits and stays. Rudy hits and busts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POP! That was My card!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... I had a five...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're hitting for MY cards!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley's eyes on her watch. Nods to Merlin and Pug:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jumpy has left the table, sidling to a change booth, glan at his watch. Passes a $100 bill:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could Fat-Man-With-Flying-Horse get  some quarters, please?

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BLACKJACK
dialogues.text: Gabriel slides off his stool, punches Rudy in the shoulde

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be back, Wal-Mart. Watch my bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy nods, slugging beer. He's becoming an unruly drinker The Old Timer motions to hit; but before the Dealer can p the card, Rudy slams the table, points to it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is my card, guy. My card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hit, mister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't hit. (to Old Timer) You didn't hit. You're not hitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you don't even know what it is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dealer hits grandpa to twenty-one. Then hits Rudy and busts him. Rudy stares darkly.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HALL TO THE BATHROOMS
dialogues.text: Gabriel walks to the men's room door. Then stops. Adjusts the rifle under his red coat. And turns back.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE CHANGE BOOTH
dialogues.text: Jumpy is handed a bucket of quarters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin and Pug march toward the entrance, hands in pocket

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Security Boss returns upstairs, beside Jack Bangs, wh watching the video monitors. On one screen, a parking lot cam shows Merlin and Pug approaching:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's two more coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, there we go. That's the spirit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drunkenly clinks his battle to the Security Boss, wass The Boss frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack? Is there a union for department  store Santas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy bolts up suddenly, sends chips and his chair to the  carpet. Points sternly at the Old Timer, slurring:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Switch seats with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're taking my money. Switch seats  with me. Switch seats with me if  you're not taking my money --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ninety-two years old --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then get yourself another table!   You're hitting Santa's cards and  you're taking Santa's money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no other table --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEY'LL OPEN ONE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy grabs the blackjack table and wrenches with all his  might, OVERTURNING IT, cards, chips, cash scattering --

dialogues.speaker: AND EVERYTHING HAPPENS AT ONCE
dialogues.text: Two SECURITY GUARDS at the door (?) rush for Rudy -- Gabriel steps from the restroom, hall, moves toward the k door to the security level -- Jumpy carries his bucket of quarters past the cage -- Rudy tackles the Old Timer, fists and false teeth flying, the Guards arrive, trying to wrench him off the poor guy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hard whisper) Stay down, pop! Trust me, stay down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Gabriel stops just beyond the keypad door --

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SECURITY LEVEL
dialogues.text: The Security Boss grabs more men, while Jack Bangs merely smiles at the sight. Guards wrestling a drunken Santa:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help them down there! HELP them!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CASINO
dialogues.text: Three guards CHARGE out of the keypad door -- -- right past Gabriel, who slips deftly inside --

dialogues.speaker: AND UP THE PRIVATE STAIRCASE
dialogues.text: -- opening his coat, pulling his assault rifle --

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Right at the top of the stairs, right at the top of the  stairs... -- charging to the top, starting right and running SMACK  into a wall. He spins, sees the doorway's on his left --

dialogues.speaker: TO A PRIVATE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: with three doors. Gabriel stops at the first, grips his g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Video room, video room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and swings open a closet bathroom. He frowns, confused Jumps to the second door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Map said video room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and swings open a storage closet. Gabriel grumbles, le to the third door and flings it open,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Map said goddamn video room!

dialogues.speaker: TO REVEAL THE MAIN SECURITY AREA
dialogues.text: -- with two Guards sitting at their posts, and Jack Bangs the Security Boss and the Video Guard in the doorway to t video room. Which is on the far opposite side of the spac As they turn to see the furious Santa Claus with the AK-4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT THE FUCK IS GOING ON                        !!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as he SPRAYS the ceiling with GUNFIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the RIFLE sounds, just as Jumpy grips his bucket of quarters at the cashier's cage and wheels -- -- throwing a fragmentation grenade's worth of quarters a the two Cashiers! Bits Of metal flying between the bars.  They SCREAM, stepping backwards in defense -- -- and Jumpy whips a sawed-off shotgun from his coat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step BACK from the desks!

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BLACKJACK
dialogues.text: The five guards wrestling Rudy spin and scramble, pulling pistols from shoulder holsters as --

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: CHARGES through the casino entrance, shotgun held --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DROP 'EM! DROP, DROP, DROP!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the floor) DROP THE GUNS! NOW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the guards don't. Whirling on Merlin -- -- who OPENS FIRE, BLASTING two of the guards off their f Rudy stays on the ground, covering his head, holding the  petrified Old Timer down -- -- as the other three guards FIRE back, forcing Merlin to race behind the slots. BULLETS rip into slot machines -- -- as GUNSHOTS ring out from the casino restaurant. Two o the Guards spin to look behind them as -- -- PUG storms in, contorted glee, twin pistols BLAZING,  popping a steel flurry into an outgunned Guard. Merlin spins from hiding behind the slots. He and Pug bot OPEN FIRE, blowing away the two remaining men from both s One of the guards falls in front of Rudy, gun in hand -- -- but as Rudy-reaches for the guy's pistol --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it right there, Nick. Your squirt  gun's all you need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin steps to him, gun aimed. He and Pug collect the Gu weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cover 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy gets to his feet, pulls the water pistol from his po Moves to round up the Old Timer, the waitress, the Poker  Players and the Fat Slots Women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, guys. But what the hell were  you doing here an Christmas Eve  anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Guards lie on the floor, with Security Boss and V Guard. And the ruined Jack Bangs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... not here... please... mister...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel storms to the video room's doorway. Slams a new c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister. I'm begging, 'kay? I'm  begging. This is not some card club,  'kay? This is the Tomahawk. We're an  international gaming destination.  We're in guidebooks. You can't do  this... you can't do this to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He OPENS FIRE, BLOWING AWAY the wall of monitors and VCR' recording the robbery. SPARKS and METAL fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley waits in the Nova, checking her watch. Behind her RED WRANGLER rolls in and parks. A FIRE CHIEF and his DEP just off-duty, stroll toward the casino, laughing. Ashley sinks low, panicked. Presses her HORN. The firemen spin around but don't see her. They shrug. Keep walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy forces the gamblers and employees behind the bar. On the floor with Bear the Bartender, whispering hard:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down and stay down, and you're  gonna be fine. Just don't do anything.  My friends are disturbed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hostages do as told. Rudy breathes relief, squirt gun hand. And then stares at the array of bottles around him.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CASHIER'S CAGE
dialogues.text: Merlin and Pug force the cashiers to the floor:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the security code to the Count  Room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security code? What security code?   You just use a key!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK SAID SECURITY CODE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Nick?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pug bangs the guy's head off the floor, stalks to the Cou Room door. Just a key lock. Pug BLOWS it away with his gu kicks the door open -- -- and gets SHOT TO HELL by three COUNT MEN inside, pisto blazing! Pug puppets, dead. A wad of chaw hits the ceilin Stunned Merlin FIRES BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as the Firemen hear the GUNFIRE, pulling holstered pis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- while Merlin dives out of the cage, joining Jumpy, tak cover as the Count Men FIRE AWAY -- -- as Rudy scrambles back from the bar --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said no GUNS in there! NO GUNS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin and Jumpy leap up, GUNS BLAZING, firing through th cage bars at the Count Men. Killing all three just as --

dialogues.speaker: THE OFF-DUTY FIREMEN
dialogues.text: storm through the doors, pistols ready --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DROP IT! DROP THE GUNS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin and Jumpy are caught. Trade a look. And let their  weapons fall, turning just as --

dialogues.speaker: THE CHEVY NOVA
dialogues.text: CRASHES through the casino doors, MOWING DOWN the firemen The car SLAMS inside, crashing into slot machines. The sl send SPARKS showering into the air. Which set off the cas floor's SPRINKLERS. The room fills with watery spray. Ashley swiftly climbs out of the mangled vehicle. Rudy st darkly at her. She knows he knows. And she doesn't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wild-eyed) WHERE'S THE FUCKING CASH, NICK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That's love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She storms on by. The slots pay off behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jumpy, Merlin, Ashley and Rudy step inside the Count Room There are stacks and stacks of bills. Ashley smiles wide, throws Jumpy three laundry sacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVE, MOVE, MOVE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin, meanwhile, slams Rudy against the wall:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew there were guns in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin, I didn't know --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got Pug killed! You tried to get  ME killed! You just lost your Get- Outta-Jail-Free --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise you, I didn't know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Merlin puts a gun to Rudyls head --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over casino speakers) Santa Claus, Santa Claus, and Santa  Claus... would you please bring our...  mapmaker... to the security level?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin stares daggers at Rudy. Shoves the gun away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel stands at the windows overlooking the watery carn The taped jingle of slots still plays. Poor Jack Bangs lies on his desk, beaten to a pulp. Blood runs down his face and shark suit. Tears and shock:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go back to Vegas... I can't...  go back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is with this place?   Thought the video room was back there --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlin and Jumpy lead Rudy in. Ashley follows. They carry bulging money sacks. Gabriel stares Rudy down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you not to fuck us with that  map, Nick. I told you not to, and  you did. How am I s'posed to keep my  promises now? (Ashley joins him) How's she s'posed to keep hers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her hard. Sloppy. Grins. Then points to Jack Bangs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't tell us where it is. The  Powwow Safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... what you're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel hammers him with the butt of his rifle. CRACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE POWWOW SAFE! WHERE IS THE POWWOW  SAFE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... Powwow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Powwow Safe where you steal your  money! Where you cheat your Indians!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't steal any --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel CRACKS him again. And again. Rudy winces. Gabriel grabs Rudy, pulls him over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We KNOW about the Powwow Safe! We  KNOW it's in here! We KNOW how you  work! Because WE know who's worked  for you! (smiles) Remember a guy named Nick Mason!?  A  security guard named Nick Mason!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel pushes Rudy's head toward the desk. Jack Bangs,  drooling blood, eyes swollen, turns his face to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick... Mason... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack Bangs stares at Rudy. Rudy stares back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...so where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs, mocking) Where is he?! Where is he?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not Nick Mason...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smile fades from Gabriel's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick Mason... worked for me two years  ago. This man... (a spark of recognition) ...he's some cowboy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel grabs Rudy, slams him against a wall. He glares a Ashley for answers. She stares in disbelief. Rudy meets her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucked the wrong guy, Ashley. (shrugs) Story of your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did time with Nick Mason, Monster.   Told you that from the start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley's putting it all together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... you... YOU --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We still gonna spend Christmas  together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley CHARGES him. Gabriel stops her; Merlin and Jumpy h hold her back. Gabriel spins on Rudy with his rifle:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are lucky, convict. You're  spending Christmas with the birthday  boy himself --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! HEY! THERE IS A POWWOW SAFE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel hesitates. Doesn't fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did time with Nick Mason, remember?   I knew he worked here, didn't I!?   Well, some shit he told me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy steels himself for the shot. It still doesn't come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick told me his manager kept a safe  in his office, his stealing safe.  His Powwow Safe. I swear, please...   Nick told me. (looks to Jack Bangs) Behind the liquor cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack Bangs dully meets Rudy's eyes. Gabriel steps to the liquor cabinet, feels at the shelves They split in the middle. And there is a combination safe mounted in the back. Gabriel turns to Jack Bangs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls him off the desk. Jack Bangs wavers, struggling. looks at Gabriel. Then at Rudy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go back to Vegas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN IT!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack Bangs steps to the safe. Spins the lock. Spins back. Spins forward. Click. Jack Bangs looks at Rudy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Pow. Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Jack Bangs opens it -- -- reaching inside in the same swift motion, so that as t safe swings open to reveal it's a rack of WEAPONS that li inside, Jack Bangs already has an Uzi in hand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VEEEEGGGGAAAASSSS!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BULLETS as he turns back to the room -- -- sending Gabriel, Ashley, and Merlin diving for the flo Jumpy can't get down, as BULLETS riddle him dead -- -- and BLOW OUT the smoked windows overlooking the casino Jack Bangs keeps turning in a madman's circle -- -- BLOWING OUT the windows to the parking lot, shattering the liquor, sending Rudy scrambling under his desk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I CAN'T! GO BACK! I CAN'T! GO BACK!  I CAN'T! GO BACK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GO!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Ashley both scramble for the windows, jumping out  with two of the money sacks --

dialogues.speaker: TO THE CASINO FLOOR
dialogues.text: -- and landing on poker tables below, overturning them -- Jack Bangs keeps FIRING, into the casino, SHREDDING the t but missing Gabriel and Ashley -- as he JUMPS right after them.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN BANGS' OFFICE
dialogues.text: Merlin scrambles to his feet, whirling with his gun, look for Rudy -- -- just as Rudy slams into him. Merlin's SHOT hits the  ceiling. The two of them CRASH down, wrestling and rolling toward parking lot window. Two guns spill to the floor. Rudy gra one, just as Merlin kicks out, leaping up -- -- and freezes, seeing Rudy's got a pistol on him. Before Merlin can make a move, Rudy fires -- -- and a thin stream of water shoots out. Leaving a stain his shirt. It's the water pistol. Rudy stares blankly. As Merlin swiftly snatches the second gun, a real gun, of the floor. Rudy's dead to rights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell. I'm gonna take pleasure in  this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the gun on Rudy, Merlin finds a cigarette in his poc Pops it between his lips, raises a lighter's flame -- -- and hesitates. Sniffing the air. Looking down. At the stain on his shirt. His lighter still lit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and Rudy fires the water pistol again, this time catch Merlin's lighter, which turns the stream into a ARC OF FI He's filled alcohol in the gun! FLAMING LIQUOR shoots into Merlin's face and eyes. He dro the handgun. Rudy keeps squeezing the squirt gun, spreadi the fire down his neck and chest. Merlin howls wildly -- -- and staggers back, blind and helpless, pinwheeling him

dialogues.speaker: OUT THE PARKING LOT WINDOW
dialogues.text: -- and CRASHING down on the hood of a Pontiac, head throu the windshield, boots on the bumper, dead. Flames flicker

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke 'em if you got 'em.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CASINO
dialogues.text: Gabriel and Ashley have scrambled to the Nova, tumbling i with the money sacks. Jack Bangs gets up, stalking toward them, still FIRING and babbling. Gabriel FIRES back, hitting Bangs in the chest. He stagge but stays upright. His bullets RIDDLE the car, shattering the windshield, but Gabriel and Ashley keep their heads d slamming it into reverse -- -- and burning rubber backwards out the casino entrance,  into the parking lot, and speeding out of sight. Jack Bangs stops shooting. He staggers back toward the bar, totters there, and turns gun still raised. Rudy stands at the base of the stairs to the security lev He puts his hands up, until he sees the dying look in Ban face. The uzi drops to the ground. A silence. Even the slots have stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack Bangs stares blankly. Surveys the wreckage of his po man's empire. And gives a small shrug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why they call it gambling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slumps against the bar and hits the floor. Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy ambles out into the snowy night. The lot is quiet. H takes a few wary steps toward the road -- -- and hears a CLICK. He turns to see Ashley standing beh him, with a gun. Shaking her pretty head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy shuts his eyes for the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nova drives up a ramp into the back of the truck, in  reverse. Gabriel gets out, pulls shut the trailer. Ashley collects the hazard triangles. They hurry to the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Motor City monster storms through the night, passing couple POLICE CARS, sirens wailing, speeding the other wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel and Ashley inside, with the money sacks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the wrong fucking guy! We took  the place down with the wrong fucking  guy! Is that Christmas?! Huh?! Is  that Christmas?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs Ashley, kisses her wildly. Then turns back --

dialogues.speaker: TO THE SLEEPER COMPARTMENT
dialogues.text: Where Rudy lies sideways, hands bound with his Santa belt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God bless us every one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A winding two-lane road, overlooking a small ravine at a  grassy overlook. The road is dusted with snow; there's be no traffic here for awhile. The Motor City Monster steams to a stop beyond the overlo Then starts backing up, such that the gate of the trailer fifteen feet from the edge of the ridge. A hundred-foot drop into the ravine below. Gabriel and Ashley pile out of the cab. They lift the tra gate, extend the tire ramps. The ramps run from the trail to five feet away from, the ravine drop.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CAB
dialogues.text: Gabriel pulls Rudy out of the sleeper. Marches him back -

dialogues.speaker: TO THE RAVINE'S EDGE
dialogues.text: -- and gives him a look. Forces him to his knees. Ashley in the truck trailer, splashing the inside of the Nova wi a can of gasoline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You almost got away with it, Santa.  Got outta the Tomahawk, got to your  car, got halfway to Canada till you  caught some ice in the road. By the  time you hit bottom down there, whole  car was burning like a comet.  Musta  burned up all that money too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy glances to the trailer. Ashley tosses a couple handf of bills into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buncha guys in red suits busted in,  they'll say. Started shooting. They  won't be able to remember... if it  was three, or four... or five. Four  dead Santas and some burned-up cash.  Merry Christmas, The End.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it your plan, Monster? Or was it  hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She told me 'bout the convict  magazines. Had to figure there'd be  some boys in the pen with some useful  knowledge. With nobody to talk to.  Nobody to listen. So we stocked up  on stationery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley hops down. Gabriel puts an arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard life being a trucker's girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy eyes Ashley. She stares darkly back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saved your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did love you, you know. Nick. He  did love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So cold. But Rudy doesn't pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe this is where you wanted him,  Ashley. At the bottom of a ravine,  dead as ice with a burnt-up heart.  Maybe. But it didn't happen. 'Cause  what you did for him was make him  the happiest held ever been. You  showed him hope and taught him mercy.   And he died a peaceful man. You wanted  to destroy some convict... and all  you did was save his soul. Remember  that. Love your money and remember  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley shivers, a touch shaken. But steels herself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas, Rudy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad it was me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel hauls him up. Marches him to the trailer. Rudy st at the ramp. Gabriel pushes. Rudy doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the CAR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know my name...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to Ashley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy. How'd you know my name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy looks at Gabriel. He's frowning. To Ashley:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said Merry Christmas, Rudy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... you told me your name was Rudy.  You told me a million times, back in  the truck, telling me you weren't  Nick --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were screaming you weren't Nick!  And we just didn't fucking believe  you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I never said Rudy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it a million times!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never told you my name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares her down. Then stares at Gabriel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know my name was Rudy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know my name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley stares daggers. Shakes her head ruefully --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and pulls a handgun, SHOOTING Gabriel in the heart. Gabriel falls to his knees in the snow, his mouth a ring shock. Blood spurts through his red coat. He stares at As incredulous. She steps forward and PUTS another bullet in his neck. Ga falls still. Ashley's breath frosts in the cold. Rudy watches her. Finally, she meets Rudy's eyes. They st each other down for a long moment, before:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A silence. No one moves. And finally, the CRUNCH of footsteps from around the side the trailer. And WHISTLING. "Silver Bells." A shadow moves across the snow behind the trailer, and so steps into Rudy and Ashley's view. It's Nick Mason. Alive and well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas, Rudy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley smiles. Her muscles-and-mustache man pen pal is he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I missed you, beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I missed you too, Nicky baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a passionate kiss. Ashley malts at the sight o him, embracing happily. Then turns to Rudy:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For your information. I never fuck  the wrong guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy just stands there, his mind playing catch-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey. Have you two been properly  introduced? Sweetness, this is Rudy  Duncan, I did almost a year with him  in the Mountain. Read him all your  letters, talked about you all the  time, made him feel like he really  knew you. (turns to Rudy) My friend... wantcha to meet Millie  Bobek. 'Member Millie Bobek, dontcha?  My girlfriend fore I went in? Worked  at that bar in Motor City, where I  manslaughtered that guy? Hell. Didn't  talk about her much once the Ashley  letters started coming, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy doesn't notice it's started to snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Millie here used to serve drinks to  these gunrunning truckers, real big  talkers, talking bout a real score  one day. I was in the Mountain, man,  what the hell, why not let her get  friendly with 'em? Let her tell 'em  an idea she had, 'bout writing guys  in prison. Getting one who could  show 'em a sure thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She set them up. All of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not have her pretend to find me?   Pretend to write me and reel me in?   Tell her new trucker-man she'd pose  as some sister of his named Ashley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you set me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always wanted to rob that casino,  Rudy. Way back when I worked there.   What better way than to get some  guys to rob it for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick shrugs. Prods Rudy up the ramp. Into the trailer:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paid the Alamo ten bucks to put the  shiv in me. He's a lifer, what does  he care. Paid a hospital guard fifty  to put out the story I was dead.  Once the wound healed up... (notes cash-sacks) Got out of the Mountain this morning.   And tonight I'm a rich man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know I'd do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk outta there and tell her I was  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks back at Ashley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because every time I read her letters,  Rudy... you listened. (to Ashley) Keep your gun on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick forces Rudy inside, unties the belt from his wrists lashes them to the bottom of the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five Santas walked into that Tomahawk,  Rudy. That's what the witnesses'll  say. So we gotta have five Santas  not walk out. Gotta have five... (working) This'll burn right away... in the  fire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick gets Rudy's wrists locked to the wheel. He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, you never needed to convince  Ashley you were me. Just the dumb  fucking truckers. I figured I'd talked  enough about the Tomahawk in the pen  for you to get by --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talked about the old man's weapons  stash, probably forgot I'd remember

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm. Well. They'd have killed you if  you weren't me, Rudy. We knew you'd  start convincing 'em soon enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick slams the car door, locking Rudy in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They had the weapons and the  willpower. We just gave them their  inside man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave them me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave them me. (shrugs, smiles) Said some nice things about me, Rudy.  I appreciate it. But don't worry. I  do love her. And she loves me. You  had that right all along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick reaches across him, releases the brake. Puts the car into "Drive." Turns to Ashley:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetness! Let's light up the tree!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley steps toward the ramp, taking out a matchbook. Nic steps further into the trailer, to the back of the Nova.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CAR
dialogues.text: Rudy immediately wriggles his hands, trying to touch his  wrists together. Trying to press together the white cuffs his Santa suit. Trying to get the right pressure point -- -- as a BLADE suddenly springs out of the cuff! The  switchblade he'd stolen from the Blazer -- it's lashed to his right wrist! Rudy starts sawing his wrist back and forth, cutting thro the Santa belt -- -- his hands at the bottom of the wheel, too low for eith Ashley or Nick to see --

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TRAILER
dialogues.text: Ashley is at the hood of the car, LIGHTING her match. Nic is at the back bumper, ready to push it down the ramp --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Rudy! Nice spending time  with you!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CAR
dialogues.text: The belt breaks! Rudy snaps his hands free! But instead o trying to escape, he reaches under the steering column,  RIPPING its panel away and pulling wires free! As Ashley tosses her match onto the hood, and FIRE races  over the body of the car, TONGUES racing inside, over the dash, over the seats, lapping at Rudy -- -- who ducks his head beneath the wheel, frantic to locat the right leads --

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TRAILER
dialogues.text: Ashley jumps out of the way, to the snow. Nick pushes the flaming car to the trailer's edge -- -- starting on down the ramp, the ravine ahead -- -- and as gravity starts to take the metal bonfire --

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CAR
dialogues.text: Rudy sparks two wires together, FLAMES eating at him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIKE RIDING A BIKE, LIKE RIDING A  BIKE, LIKE RIDING A BIIIIIKE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and the ENGINE IGNITES! Rudy slams the gearshift into "Reverse", grabs the wheel looks over his shoulder at shocked Nick behind him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RULE ONE! NEVER PUT A CAR THIEF BEHIND  THE WHEEL!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and SLAMS the accelerator.

dialogues.speaker: ON FULL SCENE
dialogues.text: As the burning Nova races backwards up the ramp, and back into the trailer -- Terrified Nick turns to run but there's nowhere to go -- -- and the car SLAMS into the trailer's back, CRUSHING Ni legs between metal and metal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOOOOOOO!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Rudy faces front, pounds the shift into "Drive."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RULE TWO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley stands at the bottom of the ramp, vengeance and ra She grabs her handgun, OPENS FIRE -- -- and Rudy SLAMS the gas again, shooting down the ramp - -- as he flings open the car door, dives and rolls -- -- while the burning Nova COLLIDES with Ashley, throwing onto the hood, and sending the tandem inferno speeding of the ridgetop -- -- arcing slowly as it PLUMMETS into the ravine, a smokin blazing shooting star with a woman's figure hanging on. The shooting star hits Earth and explodes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same four shots that opened the film. The Santa on th floor of the cage (Pug), the Santa on the hood of the car (Merlin), the Santa in the hallway (Jumpy). And the Santa lying face-down on the snowy road. Gabriel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last of the opening images. Rudy's motionless Santa  figure, upside-down on the snowy incline, bits of his sui still aflame. He opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWY ROAD
dialogues.text: Rudy staggers to his feet. Battered and dazed. Looks at  Gabriel's body. Then looks to the trailer. Inside, Nick is still alive, bones broken from the waist  down. He's mumbling madly, staring at the ceiling:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Rudy... help me... Rudy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy climbs the tire ramp. And pulls the trailer gate shu He climbs into the rig's cab. Starts the engine. Puts the truck in reverse, taps the accelerator and hops out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Rudy! Rudy! HELP ME!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck rolls backwards. And into the ravine. Rudy listens to its TUMBLING SOUNDS all the way to the bo He then looks up the road one way. Then the other. And notices the two money sacks sitting in the snow. He stares at them. A long time.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT/DAY
dialogues.text: In his burnt and battered Santa suit, Rudy's figure trudg the snowy night. Two sacks over his shoulder. walking emp roads and highways. And passing a roadsign that reads "Si 35 Miles." He passes rural roads and driveways, and every time he co across a mailbox... he puts a stack of cash inside. On th soundtrack, the STRINGS and RUM-PUM-PUM-PUMS of "The Litt Drummer Boy" start to rise -- With snow falling, he passes a new sign: "Sidnaw -- 27 Mi With the sun rising, a PAIR OF CHILDREN huddle at a windo seeing the man in the Santa suit at the end of their driv Giving them something from his sack and ambling on. -- and we follow Rudy's march, stuffing presents into  mailboxes. At every-stop on the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cul-de-sac of Norman Rockwell Michigan homes. Graced wi pines and a pristine snowfall. Christmas trees in windows lights on inside, figures of FAMILIES in holiday gear. No one noticing the man in the Santa suit, his sacks long gone, walking up the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At cul-de-sac's end. Where a blackened red cuff KNOCKS. After a moment, the door opens to reveal a smiling MOTHER and FATHER in their sixties. There's a party going on ins a dining table visible beyond them. The Mother and Father's smiles disappear. Shock. Concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy...? Rudy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son? Is... is that you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Santa Claus shuffles inside, right past them. The Santa Claus sleepwalks straight for the dining room,  finding a dozen RELATIVES, laughing and eating. A table l with turkey and stuffing, gravy and cranberry, wassail an wine. The relatives stop still. The room goes silent. The Santa Claus sits down at the head of the table. Yes, it's Rudy. Without a word, he stares at the food before him. And tak a plate. He stacks it with meat and dressing and trimming and sets it in front of him. And digs in. Stuffing his face in silence. His Mother and Father return to the dining room, gaping. other relatives look likewise. All staring at Rudy. Then, while he eats, without another sound... ...the Mother takes her seat at the table... ...and the Father pulls up another chair. They touch hands privately, and turn back to their plates There's a CLANK of silverware, a SCRAPE of china, a CLINK glass, and one-by-one, the relatives resume their meals. CONVERSATION picks up where it left off, SMILES return to the table, LAUGHTER slowly rises in the room. There is Mr. Duncan and Mrs. Duncan, Aunt Lisbeth and Unc Ray, Aunt Mary and Uncle Pete, toddler Sasha and teenage  Sam, brother Mike and his girlfriend Jill, sister Stacy a her husband Bill, Grandpa Walter, little Wendy Sue... ...and at the head of the table... Rudy Duncan. Home for Christmas. CUT TO BLACK.
